Philister lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya. She has 3 children and has been doing this work for 10 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'milking'.  Her biggest challenge is 'getting dairy meal.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'level kina.'

Philister was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'it is easy to pay.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'good record keeping.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Philister replied, 'she will invest and expand her farming.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Philister owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump, automobile' but does not own 'pig, bicycle, motorcycle'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, running water, TV' but does not have 'electricity, sewing machine, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en: Jecinta is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as a determined, ambitious go-getter. She has borrowed a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a water tank that will benefit five members of her family.The tank will be used to store clean water for domestic use. She operates a beauty salon to earn an income. She faces the challenge of competition from other beauty salon owners T his is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She hopes that in future she will be financially stable.

loans.use: buy a water tank.

loans.name: Tawa

texts.en:
Tawa is 19 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has a two-year-old child. She described herself as a hardworking woman. 

For the past three years, she has been running a shop where she sells rice, pepper, vita, salt, etc. in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7 AM to 4 PM. She likes her business because of the ways the customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a pickup every time to get her goods to her business shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, oil, vita, salt, etc. for her business. 

She plans is to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, vita, salt, etc. for her business

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 37-year-old married woman. For the past 2 years, she has been successfully running a business of selling milk with the support of her husband. The man shown in the picture is her husband. She milks cows and then her husband sells the milk along with yoghurt to people in their community. Over time, Abida has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Abida has now requested for a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase another cow, and feed for its calves. She hopes to increase the milk production capacity and to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase another cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is a 43-year-old married man with four children. He is an honest and hard-working man who rears goats and currently owns twelve goats. He has been in this business for five years and has registered a lot of success which includes constructing a permanent house for his family, paying school fees for his children and he uses the goat waste as manure for his coffee and banana plantations. His major challenge is lack of shelter for his increasing number of goats. He has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX to construct a shelter for his goats to prevent them being infected by diseases and also to increase their productivity. His dream is to be the largest supplier of goat’s meat in his region.

loans.use: to buy building materials to construct a shelter for his goats.

loans.name: Jose Everling

texts.es: Jose, tiene 35 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de las Flores, Lempira. El tiene 18 años de dedicarse a cultivar café. Dicha producción es vendida a intermediarios que llegan a la zona a comprar café. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos. Ha mantenido sus cultivos mediante la inversión de varios préstamos, el actual que solicita es el quinto ciclo y es por 16,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes, abonos, y resiembra de plantas de café. El préstamo le servirá a recuperar el cultivo dañado. Su meta es seguir ampliando su finca para obtener mejor cosecha e ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 35 years old and is married with two children. He lives in a village in the Flores municipality, in Lempira.

He has been growing coffee for 18 years. This production is sold to middlemen who come to the area to buy coffee.This activity is his source of income.

He has maintained his crops by investing funds from several loans. He is currently on his fifth loan and is requesting 16,000 lempiras in order to buy fertilizers and for the reseeding of coffee plants.

The loan will help him recover from a damaged crop. His goal is to continue expanding his farm in order to obtain a better harvest and income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to maintain his coffee farm

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en: Hanadi is a 22 year-old Lebanese single woman from Lebanon. She has been working as a private teacher since 2010. She adores her profession because she helps the students to get well educated. She has organized a particular room at her domicile where she receives students and has outfitted it with the necessary materials. Today, she is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase books to improve her teaching skills and to renovate the room. She notes that these purchases will facilitate her work preparation and the renovation will allow her to receive students appropriately. She is very positive about her future and wishes to receive more students in the coming school season.

loans.use: to purchase books and to renovate the teaching room.

loans.name: Christie

texts.en:
Christie is 30 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single, and completed grade 12.  She described herself as a hardworking woman.  

For the past three years she has been running a table where she sells cold water.  She sells six days a week from 7AM to 5PM; she likes her business because of the way her customers buy from her.  She started this business with money given to her by mother.  She always shares a taxi to get her goods to her business spot.  

Christie is requesting a loan to purchase more water by the sack for her business.  She plans to build a house for her children.  

She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more water by the sack for her business,

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 47 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and has five children between 21 and 30 years old. She described herself as a business-minded woman.  

For the past four years she has been running a shop selling used clothes in the local market; she sells six days a week from 7AM to 6PM.  She likes her business because she makes more profit.  She started this business with money given to her by mother.  She always shares a taxi to get her goods to her business spot. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.  She plans to build a house for her children.  

Sarah would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell at her business.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: Don Gabriel, tiene 63 años de edad, es casado, tiene cinco hijos y vive con su conyugue y tres de sus hijos en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Gracias, Lempira. El se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde muchos años y cultiva granos básicos y café. La producción de café la vende en grano seco  a los beneficios de café de la zona. Lleva seis ciclos de préstamos con ODEF de donde le ha dado asistencia  a sus cultivos. El que solicita actualmente es por 10,000 Lempiras y los invertirá en compra de fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo y seguir obteniendo los ingresos. Su plan es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y ver que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 63 years old and is married with 5 children. He lives with his wife and 3 of his children in a village belonging to the Gracias municipality,  Lempira.

He has been working in agriculture for many years and grows basic grains and coffee. He sells the coffee production of dried beans to the coffee mills in the area.

He is in his 6th loan cycle through ODEF receiving assistance for his crops. He is currently asking for 10,000 limpiras and will invest it in the purchase of fertilizers in order to improve his crop and to continue earning income.

His plan is to improve the quality of life for his family and to support his children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee plants

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El Sr. Vicente es soltero y tiene una hija Mayor de edad ya profesional, la cual crió y mantuvo por medio de su duro trabajo.  El Sr Vicente presta servicios de cobranzas a una empresa hace mas de 10 años de forma independiente. Gracias al trabajo que está realizando educo y formo a su hija en una profesional  y desde siempre compro todas las necesidades del hogar.
El Sr. Vicente solicito de este crédito para poder comprar materiales de construcción y mejorar su hogar para darle unas mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Vicente is single and has an adult daughter who's already a professional.   He raised and supported her with his hard work.

For 10 years Vicente has worked independently providing credit services to a business.  Thanks to his job he educated and raised his daughter as a professional and has always bought the household necessities.

Vicente requested this loan to be able to buy construction materials to improve his home and give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras que lleva el nombre de  San Cayetano se encuentra en el 1º. Ciclo del programa cuenta con 14 integrantes actualmente, es un grupo muy responsable,solidario , se ayudan entre sí , agradecen por esta oportunidad para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Estefana de 71 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de Cerdo y artesania desde hace ya varios años, trabajo con el cual puede sostener económicamente a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cerdo para la cría y venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo y ayudar a su familia con los ingresos que genera.
texts.en:
This group of enterprising women named after San Cayetano is in its first loan cycle with the program.  They are 14 responsible and supportive members who help each other.  They're grateful for this opportunity to be able to grow and get ahead.

Estefana's story is worth highlighting.  She's 71 years old and has made a living selling pigs and handicrafts for several years.  She can support her family with this job.

She's requesting this loan to be able to invest in buying pigs to raise and sell.  This way she can continue with her job and help her family with the income she generates.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en:
Jannet is a 34-year-old woman from the Kayonza District in the eastern province of Rwanda. 

She is seeking a loan of RWF 60,000 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. Jannet started selling lights in February, 2012; she has sold 100 lights to date, providing clean energy to 500 people. 

She is also a shopkeeper and the Treasurer of her Nuru Group. She will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her family .

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Bozi

texts.fr: Bozi a 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants âgés de 12,09 et 05ans tous scolarisés. Ce revendeur de pièces détachées mécaniques apprécie son activité et veut même l’agrandir, notamment en se procurant un stock plus conséquent de pièces. Cette évolution est essentielle à ses yeux, car il veut pouvoir offrir le meilleur à ses enfants et sa famille. Il manque toutefois pour l’instant des fonds nécessaire à cette hausse d’activité c'est pour cela il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises afin d'atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en: Bozi is 35 years old and married. He has three children aged twelve, nine and five years old, all of them go to school. This mechanical spare parts salesman is happy in his business and would like to enlarge it, particularly by purchasing a bigger stock of parts. This progress is essential in his opinion because he wants to give the best possible life to his children and his family. However, for the moment he lacks the necessary funds to enhance his activity, which is why he requests a first loan from WAGES to buy more stock with a view to reaching his goal.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Kouami

texts.fr: Kouami s’est lancé en 2009 dans le commerce de friperies et dispose à 48 ans de sa propre boutique. Afin d’aider leurs enfants dans leurs études et leur vie active, notamment les trois plus  jeunes (6, 8 et 22ans), il souhaite étendre son activité  en proposant à ses clients une gamme de produits plus large. C'est dans cette lignée qu'il sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en: Kouami started a business selling second-hand clothes in 2009 and now, at the age of 48, owns his own shop. In order to be able to support his children, notably the 3 youngest ones (6, 8 and 22 years old), with their education and in their active lives, he would like to expand his business by offering his customers a larger range of products. He is therefore requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to fulfill his needs.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is a 29-year-old man from the Bugesera district in the eastern province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will sell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Celestin started selling lights in July, 2012, and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people. 

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Jeannette, and their two children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel esta estudiando la carrera de Enfermería, cuenta que por medio de esa carrera podrá ayudar a las personas que necesitan atención en su salud. Su sueño siempre fue el de ayudar a quienes necesiten atención en algo tan importante como es la salud.
Ella cuenta que es su familia la que la inspira a seguir con sus metas, ya que le han enseñado el valor del estudio y cuan importante es para poder salir adelante. Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de la universidad, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Isabel is studying for degree in nursing. She says that through this career she will be able to help to people who need health care. Her dream has always been to help those who need care in something so important as health.

She says that it was her family who inspired her to continue toward her goals, as they have taught her the value of education, and how important it is for success in life. Now she is requesting this loan so that she can invest it in paying her university fees, as this way she will be able to continue studying.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Luque. Son seis jóvenes que se unieron con el objetivo de poder empezar a trabajar y salir adelante para ayudar a sus familias. Ellos están muy entusiasmados ya que podrán ayudar con los ingresos de la casa, y de esa forma poder sentirse útiles.
Uno de estos jóvenes es Katerine quien tiene 17 años, está queriendo emprender en Venta de Bijouterie. Ella es una joven de muy buena familia, todos son muy trabajadores, y quiere poder seguir el ejemplo que su mama le dio, y de esa forma poder ayudarles y que se sientan orgullosa de ella.
Pide de este crédito para la compra de canutillos, hilos, pinzas, etc. Con lo cual ella misma podrá hacer los bijouterie para vender.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Luque. It is made up of six young people who got together with the goal of beginning to work and get ahead to help their families. They are very excited that they will be able to help contribute to the household income and feel useful.

One of these young people is Katerine, who is 17 years old. She would like to start selling jewelry. She is the child of a very good, hard-working family, and she wants to follow the example that her mother set for her so that she can help her family and make them feel proud of her. 

She requests this loan so that she can buy beads, thread, tweezers, etc. With these things, she will be able to make jewelry to sell.

loans.use: to buy beads, thread, tweezers, etc. in order to make jewelry.

loans.name: Maykarn Group

texts.en:
Maykarn is a group composed of four Filipino ladies, who work as housekeepers for Lebanese families. They decided to form the Maykarn group in order to mutually support each other financially. Maryann is the leader and featured member of the group. She is a 44-year-old single mother of four children, standing on the far left of the picture. Her four children live in the Philippines. Their only financial resource is their mother, since their father does not participate in the family resourcing. She decided to join the Maykarn group in order to acquire a group loan from Al Majmoua. In fact, this loan would really help her to support her family back in the Philippines. 

Roselyn is a 36-year-old single lady, wearing green in the picture. Her dire situation motivated her to join the Maykarn group and acquire a group loan in order to financially support her family back in the Philippines.

Durinan is a 34-year-old single lady, wearing white in the picture. Just like her friend Roselyn, she is need of the Al Majmoua loan because she needs to financially provide for her family.

Rosalyn is a 32-year-old lady, standing on the far right of the picture. She decided to join the Maykarn group and acquire a group loan from Al Majmoua because she needs to transfer it urgently to her family in the Philippines.

loans.use: to support her family back in the Philippines.

loans.name: Ronald Guillermo

texts.es: Ronald de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres, posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas lo prefieren y lo mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, Ronald  es un hombre dedicado a su labor, enérgico y con muchas metas por delante, su mas grande secreto para alcanzar el éxito, es la constancia y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así logrará lo que desea, como todo buen comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. ronald tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ronald, 33, lives in his own house with his parents.  He has a store where he sells necessity items: beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other things.  He has had his business for many years, which has given him sales experience that allows him to earn the best profits.

His store is located in his house in a very busy area.  He has acquired a lot of customers because his is the most-stocked store.  People prefer him and support him over the competition because he always has what they need: quality products, affordable prices, and incomparable customer service.

Ronald is energetic and dedicated to his job, and he has many goals in mind.  His biggest secret to success is persistence and love for his job.  He knows that's the only way to achieve what he wants.

Like any good merchant he wants to grow his business and make a new investment.  He needs capital, though, so he's asking Integral for a loan to buy basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, beverages, etc.

Ronald has a good payment record and is certain he'll repay his debt.  He also trusts he'll give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Ekoe

texts.fr: Ekoe est revendeur de matériel informatique. Ce pasteur âgé de 38 ans, marié et père d’un jeune enfant, rêve d’obtenir un prêt qui pourrait lui donner l’occasion d’agrandir son activité pour assurer l’avenir de sa famille naissante, à long terme. Avec sa femme cuisinière, il veut dès le départ offrir le meilleur à sa famille à venir.
texts.en: Ehoe sells computer products. This 38-year-old pastor, who is married and the father of a young child, dreams of receiving a loan which will enable him to expand his business so that he can ensure a good future for his burgeoning family in the long term. Together with his wife, who is a cook, he would like to be able to offer his future family the best life he can.

loans.use: to buy computer products.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is a 21-year-old single Lebanese man. Since 2011, he has operated a bakery where he produces bread and tasty pastries. To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting today to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. He will use the loan to buy raw materials such as flour, sugar, and butter in addition to other supplies which he needs to continue production and expand his product inventory. He expects an increase in his income as he is expanding his work and hopes that his business will grow. He dreams of being able to reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Boinetta

texts.en:
Boinetta is running a medicine store in Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado county. The area is home to “round time marketeers” - traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. 

Boinetta makes a lot of profit since she is the only one running a drugs store in her community. Her profit is used on house rent, food, school fees, and to improve her savings account. A problem she faces is limited stock. She started this business initially by just selling to her friends. Her husband works as a medical doctor. They have three children who are in school and live at home. She is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs such as paracetamol, folic acid, cough syrup, blood tonic and quinine to expand her sales. Boinetta is 46 years old, and has obtained a university degree. Her plan is to improve her business even more. She thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more drugs such as paracetamol, folic acid, cough syrup, blood tonic and quinine to expand her sales.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée à un pasteur et mère d’un très jeune enfant, Odile est vendeuse ambulante de pagnes. Pour elle, le meilleur moyen de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille nouvellement fondée est d’obtenir un point de vente fixe directement sur le grand marché de Lomé. Pour faire face aux dépenses qui seront engendrée par cette nouvelle situation, Odile souhaite obtenir un prêt destiné à l’appuyer.
texts.en: Odile is married to a pastor and is the mother of a very young child. She is a street seller of pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth). For her, the best way of being able to meet the needs of her newly formed family is to obtain a fixed spot at the Lomé Grand Market. In order to be able to cover the expenses generated by this new situation, Odile would like to receive a loan to support her.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 33 years old and lives in the area of West Point, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She lives with her fiancee, who is a carpenter. They have two children aged 11 and 8 who are in school and live at home. She describes herself as a hardworking person.

For the past 3 years she has been running a shop where she sells plantains, corn, and other items in the local market. She likes her business because she has good business relationships with her customers.  She started this business with money given to her by her fiancee, She uses a taxi everyday to buy her goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantains, corn, and other items. Eventually, she plans to buy a piece of land and build a house.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia's efforts to enable small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains, corn, and other items for her business.

loans.name: J.nepo

texts.en:
J.Nepo is a 26-year-old man from the Rwamagana district in the eastern province of Rwanda. He is the greatest beneficiary of the Kiva pilot in Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which he will sell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

J.Nepo started selling lights in July, 2011; he has sold 180 lights to date, providing clean energy to 900 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To further expand his business by purchasing ten low-cost rechargeable LED lights, which he will then sell to rural households that are without electricity.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 38-year-old man from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. 

Emmanuel started selling lights in May 2012, and he has sold 130 lights to date, providing clean energy to 650 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife and children.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Al-Waseem 14183 Group

texts.en:
Al Wassim is a group composed of four Lebanese women living in a small village in Mount Lebanon. They decided to join hands and form the group in order to acquire a group loan together from Al Majmoua. 

Sawsan is the leader and featured member of the group. She is a 34-year-old married mother of two children, wearing red in the picture. She owns a small beauty business, where she does makeup for a living. Her husband works as a blacksmith. Their combined revenue is not sufficient to provide a better life for their children, especially since their children are both enrolled in a private school. The highest education Sawsan ever acquired was intermediate, which means that she wants the best alternative for her children. She needs the Al Majmoua loan in order to settle tuition fees, and purchase merchandise and products for her business.

Hiyam is a 40-year-old married mother of three children, wearing brown in the picture. She owns a small business where she assembles flowers and sells them. Her husband is an employee in the army. Her three kids are enrolled in private schools, which means that she has to settle the tuition expenses on top of the other expenses. She needs the Al Majmoua loan in order to pay off the next tuition fees, and to buy a work kit.

Rabab is a 32-year-old married mother of two children, standing on the far left of the picture. For a living, she works in handmade beads and piece work. Her husband is an employee in the ministry of tourism. Both her children are enrolled in private schools. She needed the Al Majmoua loan in order to settle tuition fees expenses and to purchase materials for her handmade work.

Nagham is a 28-year-old single lady, standing on the far right of the picture. She is employed in a company that employs housekeepers. She decided to join the group and acquire a loan because she needs to prepare for her engagement ceremony, which is taking place soon.

loans.use: to settle tuition fees, and purchase merchandise and products for her business.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as determined. He has taken a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy a small water tank that will benefit six members of the family. The family faces inadequate water supply from the city council and also inadequate rainfall. The water tank will enable them to store and access clean water. 

He runs a butchery to earn an income. He hopes that in future, he will be able to purchase a bigger tank and also bulls. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store and access clean water.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as focused and determined.  

She has taken a loan of Kes 20,000 to buy a water dispenser that will benefit six members of her family; they have been facing a challenge of accessing clean and safe water. This will keep the water clean and safe.

She operates a retail shop where she sells soft drinks, cooking oil, biscuits, washing soap, etc. to earn an income.  Agnes hopes that in future she will own a wholesale shop. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water dispenser for her family.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 48 years old and lives in the West point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has nine children. Only one is in school and two of them live at home. Julia describes herself as a hardworking woman. For the past three years she has been running a market table where she sells fish in the local market. She sells six days in a week from 7am to 5pm. She likes her business because the customers buy from her. 

Julia started this business with money given to her by mother. She uses a shared taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She plans is to build a house for her children. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is a 41-year-old man from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. 

Jean Bosco started selling lights in May 2012, and he has sold 100 lights to date, providing clean energy to 500 people. 

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Jean Nepo

texts.en:
Jean Nepo is a 41-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a top-up loan of 30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 additional rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. 

Jean Nepo started selling lights in September 2012, and he has sold 60 lights to date (20 with the help of Kiva), providing clean energy to 300 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife, Dative, and their four children.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est vendeuse de prêt-à-porter. Cette mère célibataire de 34 ans élève seule son enfant de 7 ans et s’inquiète pour son avenir. Elle veut ainsi donner le meilleur d’elle-même dans son travail pour agrandir son activité et disposer des revenus suffisants pour éduquer convenablement son enfant. Sa première demande de prêt auprès de WAGES est destinée à acheter de nouveaux produits pour ses clients, afin de stabiliser ses revenus.
texts.en: Afi sells clothes. She is a single mother who is bringing up her seven year old child by herself and is worried about the future. For this reason, she wants to do her very best in her work, expand her activity and thus dispose of sufficient means to educate her child correctly. This is her first request from WAGES and is intended for the purchase of new products for her customers in order to stabilise her income.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Ekome Feemo Group

texts.en:
The Ekome Feemo group was created on June 23, 2010. This group is composed of women who are well-experienced in their various businesses. They are all from the same neighborhood in Teshie and all work in small-scale commerce. They sell cooking utensils, maize (corn), and ladies tops and underwear.

Evelyn is the featured borrower of the group and the group leader. She is a single mother of one and she is 30 years old. Her work involves purchasing cooking utensils at the market and selling them in her store at the one of the road side markets in Teshie.

With her new loan, she intends to purchase cooking utensils at GHS 2,000 so that she can serve customers better. With the profits, she plans on supporting her child's education and her up-keeping.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils to sell to customers.

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Group Lwanda

texts.en:
Robert is a 45-year-old married man with eight children. He lives at Bitabago village with his family, and out of eight children, five are still in primary schools.

He is a member of the Tukolerewamu Lwanda group, which is located on the outskirts of Kyotera town, about 3 kilometers away.

Robert is a farmer who deals in agriculture, specifically coffee and banana growing. He works six days in a week, and each day, he works for three hours in his plantations. He is also a teacher at Kisuula primary school, where he earns an additional income of 150,000 Ugandan shillings to supplement his income.

He has been in agriculture since 1990, which is 23 years in this field. He started this business because of experience he had and because he also wanted to earn a living.

He has acquired this loan of 500,000 shillings in order to purchase fertilizers for his banana plantation in order to increase his yields with a much improved quality. He usually supplies his output to customers from Kyotera and Kampala city.

His dreams are to complete his house, which is still under construction, increase his production, and ensure that he educates his children up to higher levels of learning. However, Robert faces various challenges, including the unpredictable weather changes which affect his yields, pests and diseases, plus the fluctuating prices, which also affect him greatly.

He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 45-year-old woman from Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

She is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000  to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Beatrice started selling lights in July 2012, and she has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. 

With the money she makes from selling and recharging lights, she will improve her adobe brick home, where she lives with her husband Philippe and her five children (Faustin, Evode, Rene, Jean de Dieu, and Lea).

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 32 years old and lives in the West Point, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single with an 11-year-old child who is in school. She stopped her education at grade 9. She describes herself as a potential businesswoman. She manages her business well to enable her to support her home. 

Over the past three years, she has been running a table in the local market without facing any serious problems. This business started with a little amount she got from her mother. She sells six days in a every week, spending 10 hours with her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion slippers for her business. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers for her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 38-year-old single woman. She has a child who is 8 years old. She describes herself as honest. Joyce operates a hotel where she sells food to customers. She will use this KES 30,000 loan to buy a solar panel to fix in the hotel. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She repaid her previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.es: Darlyn es una clienta con 35 años de edad, casada y madre de un niño. Profesional, trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación. Se dedica a su negocio hace tres años sin descuidar a su familia, debido a que vió la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares. Cuenta con el apoyo de él en su negocio, cuando debe de tomar ideas o decisiones. Sus clientes son familiares, vecinos, maestras y trabajadores de diferentes instituciones de la comunidad. El préstamo lo va invertir en reforzar su negocio, aumentando su patrimonio con el inventario y asi ofrecer más variedad de productos, dar mejor facilidad de pago y obtener mayores ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida y la de mi familia.
texts.en:
Darlyn is 35 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She is professional, hard-working, and wants to improve herself. She has worked in her business for the past three years without neglecting her family, since she believed it was necessary to help her husband with their family's expenses. She counts on her husband's support of her business when she needs new ideas or to make decisions.

Her clients are family members, neighbors, teachers, and workers in various institutions in the community. She will invest the loan in strengthening her business, increasing her assets and inventory, and thus offering a greater variety of products, providing easier payment options, and earning more income to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: tupperware.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as focused, determined, and optimistic. She has borrowed KES 20,000 to buy a water tank that will benefit six family members. This will ensure they have access to clean and sufficient water, especially during times of scarcity.  Paulina sells herbal medicine to earn an income and she faces a challenge of competition in this business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. She repaid previous loans of amounts KES 20,000 and KES 70,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Enerstine

texts.fr: Ernestine, mère de deux enfants et vendeuse de légumes et tubercules depuis 1992, souhaite se constituer un pécule afin de mettre sa famille à l’abri du besoin. Elle souhaite notamment créer de nouveaux points de vente. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettrait d’acheter les nouveaux stocks de légumes dont elle aura besoin.
texts.en: Ernestine, who has two children has been a vegetable and tuber seller since 1992. She would like to put a small nest egg of money on one side to keep her family free from want. In particular, she would like to open new points of sale. To achieve this, she requests a loan which would enable her to buy the new stock of vegetables which she will need.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, tubers and various products.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as optimistic and focused. She has taken a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy a water tank that will benefit the four members of her family. They will be able to store enough clean and safe water.

She sells milk to earn an income, and she faces a challenge of competition and lack of proper facilities to keep clean and safe milk. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business to sustain her family and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean, safe water.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 39-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda.  He is seeking a top-up loan of RWF 30,000 to buy 10 more rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  Paul started selling lights in September 2012, and he has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people.  He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Leonie, and their four children (Dative, Marie Leonille, Claudine and Jean Paul).

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households that do not have electricity.

loans.name: Odel

texts.en:
Odel is 33 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is a college student and is good at managing her business. She is married and has a four-year-old child who is in school and lives at home, 

For the past four years, Odel has been selling candy, biscuits, eggs, bread, etc. from a small shop in the market. She has lot of customers and makes more profit. Odel is requesting a loan to purchase more candy, biscuits, eggs, bread, etc. for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate her child. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more candy, biscuits, eggs, bread, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is 43 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and she was unable to go to school. Viola describes herself as a hardworking woman. For the past nine years, she has been selling charcoal from a shop in the local market. She sells six days a week from 8am to 6pm. Viola enjoys her business because of the flow of her customers, and she started this business with money given to her by mother. She uses a pickup most of the time to get her goods to her shop.

Viola is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She thanks the lenders who are supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
Massa lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She is 32 years old. She did not attend school, but she engages herself in a business. She is married with three children between the ages of 18 and 7, two of whom are in school. They all live at home.

For the past seven years now, she has been involved in sales of oil, garlic, flour, etc., in the local market. She received a little amount from her mother to establish her business, and she learned this way of trading from her.  She likes her business because she makes more profit.

She is  requesting a loan to purchase oil, garlic, flour, etc., to increase her business. Her plan is to educate her children. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase oil, garlic, flour, etc., to increase her  business.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 42 años de edad, es madre soltera  de 4 hijos. Vive en compañía de sus hijos y su hermana en su casa propia. Rocío  se dedica a la compra y  venta de carne de res en diversas presentaciones como filetes, carne molida y otros. Compra la carne en los terrenos ganaderos y los vende en un puesto en el mercado de su  localidad desde donde atiende a sus clientes con mucha cordialidad. Se inició hace más de 25 años con un capital propio, comprando en pequeñas cantidades,  luego fue aumentando el volumen de sus compras ya que es un producto que tiene bastante demanda. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias económicas que obtiene diariamente. Antes de empezar con su negocio tuvo dificultades económicas ya que los gastos en su hogar se incrementaron debido a que en ese entonces se encontraba realizando sus estudios universitarios. Sin embargo, ha superado los obstáculos y continuó trabajando. Ahora desea continuar progresando por el bien de su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800 para comprar mayor cantidad de carne de res y así continuar vendiendo en el mercado.
texts.en:
42-year-old Rocío is a single mother and has four children.  She lives with her children and sister in her own home.

Rocío's business is buying and selling different cuts of beef such as steak, ground beef (mince), etc.  She buys her meat from cattle breeders and sells it from a stall in the town market where she serves her customers in a very friendly manner.  Rocío started this business 25 years ago with her own capital, buying in small quantities.  She gradually increased the amount she purchased as beef is a product that has quite a lot of demand.  She considers her business to be quite profitable because of the profits she earns every day.  Before she set up her business, Rocío experienced some financial difficulties because she was studying at university and her household expenses increased as a result.  However, she has overcome these difficulties and continued working.  She would like to continue making progress for her family's sake.  On this occasion, she is requesting 3,800 soles to buy a larger quantity of beef to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of meat to sell in the market

loans.name: Al-Ousfoura 14194 Group

texts.en: Al Ousfoura is a group composed of three Lebanese women living in a village in Mount Lebanon. They decided to join together and acquire a group loan from Al Majmoua because they are all participating in a gallery to exhibit accessories. Each of them needs a loan to buy accessories and products to sell during the exhibition. Noura is the leader and featured member of this group. She is a 47-year-old married mother of four children, standing on the left in the picture. In her daily life, she works as an employee in a printing house. Her husband owns a small gypsum manufacturing business. Her children are enrolled in private high schools, which means that she has to cover the tuition fees on top of her other expenses. The Al Majmoua loan would be truly beneficial, because it would help her develop her own business, especially through buying newly released accessories. Rouhaifa is a 46-year-old married mother of three children, standing at the right of the picture. She is Noura's colleague in the printing house. Her husband works in construction as a painter. Her three children are enrolled in private high schools. The exhibition would help her a lot in raising the family’s income, thus covering the tuition expenses. Itidal is a 38-year-old married mother of two children, standing in the center of the picture. She is employed in a shop that arranges flowers for weddings. Her husband owns a small business, where he decorates houses and renovates furniture. The Al Majmoua loan, which would help her acquire the necessary materials for the exhibition, would be highly beneficial for her future career plans.

loans.use: to buy a collection of newly released accessories for her business.

loans.name: Sitou

texts.fr: Le travail de Tèle Sitou consiste à échanger des devises sur le marché de Lomé. Toutefois, en raison de l’inflation locale, elle éprouve de plus en plus de difficultés à exercer son métier. Afin d’assurer la pérennité de son activité et aider sa famille, elle a besoin de fonds  destinés à répondre aux besoins croissants de ses clients. Le prêt qu’elle demande à WAGES, déjà le cinquième, l’aiderait grandement dans son travail.
texts.en: Tèle Sitou's work consists of changing money at the Lome market. However, due to local inflation, it is becoming increasingly difficult to do her job. In order to guarantee the durability of her work and help her family, she needs funds intended to respond to her customers' growing needs. This loan that she requests from WAGES is already her fifth loan and would help her work considerably.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 24-year-old married man living with his wife. In 2007, he decided to start his own business working as a home electrician. He works upon customer’s requests and visits them wherever they are located to serve them and satisfy their needs. Today, Hasan is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase electrical tools and supplies and he is sure that this loan will help him become more efficient at his work. This is his first Kiva loan, using which he confirms that he will be capable of achieving remarkable growth in a short period.

loans.use: to purchase electrical tools and supplies.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as committed. She has taken a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a water tank that will directly benefit two members of her family. They will be able to store clean water for use. She runs a grocery store where she sells items including bananas, carrots and oranges to earn an income. She hopes that in the future she will be succesful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as focused. He has taken out a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a water tank that will serve seven members of his family. The family faces water shortage challenges, hence the need for a water tank that will be used to store clean water for consumption. He operates a bicycle transport business, carrying customers from one place to another. He faces a challenge of competition from other operators in this business. This is his first loan from SMEP DTM. He hopes that in future he will be able to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for consumption.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a widow and has six children, one whom goes to school. She has also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for over ten years. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO, to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, chicken, ground nuts, sweet potatoes and rice. She generates additional income from renting rooms. She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis six days of every week. Her major business challenges includes the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching out to her, and also defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to build more rental rooms. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees for her grandchildren and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, chicken, ground nuts, rice and sweet potatoes for her restaurant.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is a mother of four children. She is married to a farmer. Editha sells sorghum and has been in the business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en: Beathe is 40 years old. She sells bananas and has spent ten years in the business. She has requested this loan to buy more bananas for resale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as bananas for resale

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is age 33. She sells sorghum and has been in the business for four years. She is married to a farmer and they have three children. With this loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for resale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Kichwamba Group

texts.en:
Rovina, aged 38 years, took a loan amount  of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings. She is in the Kichwamba Tweyambe Group that took a total loan amount of 3,800,000 shillings.

She is married with four children, all of them at school. Her husband was working with government but ran mad and left all the children and wife helpless; this forced her to start a small-scale business of trading in coffee and produce with the purpose of helping the children and the other two orphans she takes care of who lost their parents.
 
She works daily for eight hours. She also does farming apart from the business she started in 2004. She serves the rural population around her home.

Rovina is going to use the loan money for buying beans and coffee for selling. Her hopes are in the future of her children, for whom she labors much to see that they are educated. Her major challenge is getting school fees for her children, given her meager incomes from the business. She hopes that the bank will continue financing her business because it’s her only source of supporting the business.

loans.use: to buy beans and coffee for selling.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou s’est lancé  en 2000 dans la vente de friperies sur les marchés. Il est père de famille et souhaite financer l'étude supérieures' de ses enfants. En outre, il souhaite construire des chambres pour deux d’entre eux, mais ne dispose pas de revenu suffisants.  Il envisage, pour remédier à cette situation, d’ouvrir une autre boutique pour donner un nouveau souffle à ses ventes. Il a fait appel à WAGES pour réunir les fonds nécessaires.
texts.en: Kokou took up the sale of secondhand clothes at markets in the year 2000. He is a father and wishes to pay for his children to go through higher education. In addition, he wants to build rooms for two of them, but does not have sufficient means. To find a solution to this situation, he plans to open another shop in order to give a new dynamism to his sales. He requests a loan from WAGES to raise sufficient funds to do this.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en: Fadel is a 20-year-old, single, Lebanese man. After many years of experience, he was able to open his own barbershop in 2012. Due to his good business reputation, he was capable of harnessing a good number of loyal customers. With his requested youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, he will purchase a car. He aims to expand his work. He is ready to hire an employee who will be responsible for the salon during his absence while he visits customers at other places to provide them with his services and to gain extra income. Fadel’s only purpose at this stage is to collect money - as much as necessary -since he plans to get married soon and must meet the expensive costs.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Massy

texts.en: Massy is a single mother of two children, and one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of any other family members. She has a retail shop and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cooking oil, rice, beans, soap and salt. She works six days of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include the rainy season, which interferes with her sales, and also defaulters. She aspires to sell at the wholesale level, and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house, but the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and the cost of feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, rice and beans for her retail store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as focused and determined. She has taken out a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a water tank, which will serve three members of her family. They will be able to store clean water. She sells scrap metal to earn an income, and she faces a challenge of competition in this business. She hopes that in future she will grow socially and economically. This is her third loan from SMEP DTM. Previous loans of KES 20,000 and KES 30,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank.

loans.name: Drocella

texts.en:
Drocella is age 27. She is married, with one child. Her husband works as a house builder. 

Drocella has requested a loan to buy more sugar and cooking oil, to add to her boutique items for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used purposely for making savings.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as committed. She has borrowed a loan of KES 10,000 to buy a water tank that will benefit three members of the family. This will enable them access to clean water.

To earn an income, Christine operates a grocery shop where she sells bananas, oranges, carrots, and other items. She hopes that, in the future, she will be stable and successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en:
Viviane is 52 years old. She owns a pharmacy which she has been running for the past four years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more medicines and drugs for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children as well as to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more pharmaceutical items for sale in the pharmacy.

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen is a 24-year-old young farmer from Ijevan town. He is involved in cattle breeding. Currently his livestock includes 20 cows, 10 goats and 20 chickens. Despite his young age, Gurgen has 8 years of experience in breeding cattle. He is a very hardworking young man who does his best to sustain his parents' living.

By requesting this loan, Gurgen wants to increase the number of cattle that he has. With the help of this loan he will purchase fifteen calves which will significantly increase his income. Gurgen dreams of having a big farm and providing an appropriate lifestyle for his parents.

loans.use: to pay for fifteen calves.

loans.name: Antehwe Group

texts.en: The Antehwe Group consists of five women who live in the same town and who are engaged in different businesses: selling fresh fish, ladies’ wear, footwear, beans, maize (corn) and groundnuts. The women know one another because they are from the same neighborhood. Their representative is Sherita, who is 34 years old and married to a civil servant. They have one child. She has been operating her business, selling ladies’ wear and footwear, for over seven years. She is applying for a loan of GHS 600 to bolster her working capital. She would like to increase the goods she offers, to satisfy customer demand, which she cannot meet with her own funds. The new loan will enable her to boost her sales and to earn more money. The profits will enable her to improve her family's food situation and to raise her level of savings. One day, she would like to have her own shoe depot.

loans.use: to buy footwear and ladies' wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 39 years old and lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single. She was unable to go to school. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. For the past four years she has been selling soft drinks in the local market. She sells soft drinks from 7am to 5pm, six days a week. She likes her business because customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by mother. She uses a shared taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drink for her business. She plans is to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and thread for her business.

loans.name: Kitwe Women's Grp Group

texts.en:
Monica, a single mother in her mid-thirties, is a member of Kitwe Women’s group. Her main business is hawking used ladies' clothing around town and deep in villages. Monica claims to have done this business for the last three years, but has faced lots of challenges including dividing time between her family and business, walking for long distances under stressful weather conditions, renting a home, and daily payment of the local hawkers' tax. 

Monica has a plan of growing her business to a level that would enable her to rent a shop in town where her customers would find her and at the same time looking after her children who always come back from school to a home without a mother since she has to be away working. She has now applied for a loan of UGX 200,000 through the group to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy ladies' clothes to sell

loans.name: Lord

texts.es: Lord, de 40 años de edad, es un hombre empeñoso y trabajador, además de tener muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltero, pero es padre de 2 hijos, actualmente vive en compañía de sus hermanos y sobrinos en la casa de sus padres. Lord se dedica a brindar servicio en la elaboración de planos, asesoramiento logístico, elaboración de perfil de obras, ejecución de proyectos y otros. Su trabajo es independiente y en horarios libres dependiendo de la disponibilidad de los clientes. Tiene en su casa una computadora en donde trabaja arduamente cuando tiene algún contrato, ahí puede pasar muchas horas concentrado en realizar una buena labor. Afortunadamente, asegura que los clientes con los que ha trabajado hasta ahora se han sentido satisfechos con su trabajo y eso se confirma cuando llegan a ella otras personas que lo recomendaron. Lleva en esta actividad 13 años y se siente muy bien trabajando y haciendo lo que mas le gusta. Trabaja con la ayuda de su padre quien le provee de las herramientas necesarias para el cumplimiento de su labor. Le esta yendo muy bien en esta actividad  ya que es bien remunerada con la culminación de cada proyecto que ejecuta, al principio le fue complicado abrirse camino en este rubro, sin embargo su tenacidad y esmero le permitieron seguir adelante, ahora espera seguir progresando y que su trabajo continúe siendo reconocido. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con el logro de sus metas, además se compromete a ser un puntual y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales de escritorio y oficina que usa en su trabajo como papel A4, cd, y tintas de computadora.
texts.en:
Lord is 40 years old. He is a persevering and hardworking man and is eager to get ahead. He is single but is the father of 2 children. He is currently living with his brothers and nephews in his parents’ house.

Lord works in the development of plans, logistic consulting, drafting sketches, project overseeing, and more. He works independently and in his free time according to the availability of his clients. He has a computer at home where he works hard when he has a contract and there he can spend many hours focused on doing a good job. Fortunately, the clients he has worked with so far have been happy with his work and this is confirmed when others come to him through recommendations. He has been in this activity for 13 years and he feels contented working and doing what he likes to do. He works with the support of his father who provides the necessary tools he needs to carry out his work.

He is doing very well in this work as he is well-paid with the fulfillment of each project he completes. At first it was complicated to find a path into this field, but his tenacity and his industriousness allowed him to get ahead. Now he wants to continue progressing and hopes that his work continues to be known.

At this time he is asking for 1000 soles and is grateful for the opportunity granted him for funding the loans he needs to continue achieving his goals. He is committed to being responsible and meeting his payments on time. With the requested amount he will buy stationery and office supplies that he uses in his work, such a A4 size paper, CDs, and ink toner cartridges.

loans.use: to buy office supplies such as A4 paper and ink toner cartridges

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has no children and has been involved in agriculture for 6 years. His primary income sources are milk and tea.

He stated that to him, harvesting is most enjoyable about farming. His biggest challenge is insufficient funds. Animals on the farm have been given the name of Lelkina.

When Dennis was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, he replied that it was because of fast loan processing. He was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, to which he responded, 'It gives dairy loans.'

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked how this loan would benefit his family Dennis replied that the family income will increase.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Dennis owns a cow and a bicycle but does not own pigs, poultry, a pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net in the household but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to construct a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 24 years old. She is married, with one child. 

Alphonsine sells beans and sorghum. She would like to get the loan, to add more beans and sorghum to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 29 years old. She sells sugar and cooking oil in a boutique that she has been running for the past six years. With this loan, she would like to buy more sugar to sell. She will use her profits to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more sugar to sell.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama is 35 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have six children between the ages of 2 and 22, only three of whom are in school and live at home. She described herself as a hard-working person. For the past three years, she has been selling cassava at a table in the local market. She likes her business because customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by husband. She takes a taxi every time she goes to buy her goods. She is applying for a loan to buy more cassava for her business. She is planning to buy piece of land and build a house. She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more cassava for her business,

loans.name: Siva

texts.en:
Siva is a hard working mother. Her first connection with PT Ruma was six months ago, when she was introduced by a relative to join Ruma. Now, six months later, her average revenue per day can reach USD 130. Now she is focused to expand her mobile phone credit sales. 

Working capital loans to Ruma agents allow them to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions. Each Ruma agent has a balance with Ruma that allows him or her to sell mobile phone credit or process bill payments. When the balance is at zero, the agent cannot process any additional sales or bill payments and has to top up their balance by giving Ruma field officers cash in exchange for electronic credit. For operational efficiency, Ruma can collect from agents only as frequently as once a day and cannot collect on the weekend when banks are closed and cash can't be safely deposited there. As a result, agents often have lower sales on the weekend and have unfulfilled potential to make more transactions during weekdays when their balances are empty.
  
This working capital loan allows credit-worthy borrowers to reach their full sales potential. The loan is structured like a line of credit that the borrower uses and repays as needed during the loan term. At the end of the term, the borrower is responsible for paying back any outstanding balance so that the total amount can be returned to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Tiennie

texts.en:
Tiennie is 38 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has two children aged 1 and 6. Only one is presently in school, and both them live at home. She was unable to go to school. 

She describes herself as a hardworking woman. For the past two years she has been selling rice, oil, vita, onions, and other items in the local market. She sells six days a week from 9 am to 6 pm. She likes her business because of the strong demand she has from her customers. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a taxi every day to get her goods to her business spot. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, vita, onion, and other items for her business. In the future, she plans is to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, vita, onions, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Shalom De Karpala Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM représente le groupe  SHALOM DE KARPALA. Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 31ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. Un va à l’école et elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mme fait la restauration depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes et enfants.
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de riz, 01 bidon d’huile et des condiments.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices et agrandir son commerce. Elle ambitionne acquérir des parcelles pour ses enfants et réfectionner sa maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariam represents the SHALOM DE KARPALA  group. She is married with six children. The oldest is 31 and the youngest 13 years old. One still goes to school and three people are dependent on her.
Mariam has worked in catering for eight years. She buys her stock at her local market. Her clients are men, women and children.
She would like to buy 2 bags of rice, 1 can of oil and some condiments.
Mariam wants to save up her profits and enlarge her business. Her ambition is to buy plots of land for her children and repair her home.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of rice, 1 can of oil and some condiments.

loans.name: Arfan

texts.en:
Arfan lives in Cibubur, a semi-urban area about an hour from Jakarta. Arfan is married and lives with three persons in the family home. 

Arfan runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits. Arfan began working with Ruma a year ago because he wanted to try the mobile air time business. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last 3 months, he has around $50 to $60 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Zabayo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Safi est leader du groupe d’affaire  « Zabayo », doyenne du groupe, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 50  ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont certains ont déjà leurs familles respectives et d’autres étudient encore. Son conjoint est un enseignant dans une école publique. La cliente est vendeuse des haricots, farines, etc. Elle installe ses produits au marché ; mais aussi parfois au long de la rue. Elle commença ces affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu par son mari. Il y a 30 ans, elle fait ce petit commerce. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 3 sacs des haricots, 1 sac de farine de manioc, etc. L’insécurité dans les zones rurales occupées par les rebelles et groupes armés sont obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Safi is the leader of the business group Zabayo. At age 50, she is the eldest member of the group, and an experienced entrepreneur. She is the married mother of nine children; some of them have started their own families, and others still attend school. Her spouse is a public school teacher. 

Safi sells beans, flours and other products at the market, and sometimes by the roadside. She started this business 30 years ago with funding given by her husband. This new loan will allow her to buy three sacks of beans, one sack of cassava flour, etc. 

The current level of insecurity in rural areas occupied by rebels and armed groups represents a major obstacle to the success of her activity. 

She wants to bolster her working capital and provide for her children’s education. 

Safi is very thankful for Hekima’s support of small entrepreneurs through micro-financing. 

Photo: It should be noted that some of the group members are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of beans, one sack of cassava flour, etc.

loans.name: Jonlhing Lom Group

texts.en:
Ngahhoi is one of the members who has been with “Jonlhing Lom” since 2009. She is the featured borrower member, on the extreme left with her hand raised. 

She says with her inception in the group, she started raising pigs and also grows bananas on a large scale. She was able to purchase a used Jeep from the savings that she generated from her two businesses. She thanks her husband for his support and for bearing all the unfavourable circumstances  when she initially started her business.

Ngahhoi lives with her husband and three children. She takes care of her family, manages the household chores and also raises pigs besides engaging  with the banana plantation. She uses the Jeep for her business purposes. The Jeep is usually used as a public transport and also used by Ngahhoi to transport her banana produce into the main city to sell. Her sources of income are unreliable as it depends on the season and the market value. 

She aspires to start a pineapple farm. She says the vast fields of the village are red soils and they are left untouched. Red soil on slopes is the best for pineapple, therefore she wants to buy pineapple saplings and start the plantation. She wants to start an export business for pineapple as the market value in other states of the country is double the rate in Imphal.

With the Kiva loan, Ngahhoi will purchase 200 pineapple saplings and start the plantation.

She also dreams of owning a paddy field of her own in the future. She and her husband do farming at rented paddy fields. Thus, she also plans to do some savings and buy a paddy field for the family. 

She thanks WSDS and Kiva for the unconditional support and co-operation. She says she will always remain thankful. The rest of the group members are engaged in poultry, piggery, grocery shops and banana plantations.

loans.use: To purchase 200 pineapple saplings and start a plantation.

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Susana is one of the members of the Group Dios es Mi Pastor 3 & 4 (God is My Shepherd), located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. This group is located in one of the rural areas called Batey, populated by Haitian immigrants who came to the country to work in the sugar field plantation. Most of the members in this group are Haitian citizens.
