Susana, who sells miscellaneous products such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and accessories, is very excited to receive her 12th loan from Esperanza International, after having repaid her previous loans and thus taken a step towards expanding her business. With this loan, she is planning to purchase more inventory.

Susana tells us that her most important challenge and goal is to set up a store where she can sell all of her items instead of going outside and walking in her communities and others nearby. She enjoys being at home with her long-term partner and five children; right now just two of them live with her and their father. She is planning to reinvest her profits in her business and save for her future plans and challenges. She thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy clothes and other items.

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 6, 7 & 8 Group

texts.en:
Silvia, a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic, is the coordinator for her group, Dios Es Mi Pastor 6, 7 & 8 Group (God is my shepherd), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group, most of them Haitian immigrants, who live in the bateyes, in this city.

Silvia and her long-time partner live in a batey with their two children. A batey is a small, rural community built by a sugar company, to house their field workers. 

Silvia has a successful business selling used clothes from house to house. Used clothes are very popular in the Dominican Republic because most of the pieces are in perfect condition and have very good prices. 

With this new loan, her ninth from Esperanza International Dominican Republic, she will buy three bags of used clothes, to resell by pieces.

Silvia's main goal is to finish building her house. She thanks you for lending!

loans.use: to buy bags of used or second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nipagagnon Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe   NIPAGAGNON II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Missirikoro, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leurs deuxièmes prêts avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide   Alima  debout  en deuxième  position de la  droite vers la  gauche sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, l’engrais, herbicide et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché et aux environs après la récolte.  Elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 105.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice permettra de faire face au remboursement de son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "NIPAGAGNON II" are married women averaging 43 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional families in Missirikoro, a village in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work for the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loan was indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Alima, who is the second person standing from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, manure, and herbicides and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village, at the market, and nearby. She sells to men and women customers. She plans on making a profit of 105,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to cope with repaying her loan and also to help her big family to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Nipagagnon Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe   NIPAGAGNON III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Missirikoro, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leurs deuxièmes prêts avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide    Fatoumata Karim  assise en première   position de la   gauche vers la   droite sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, l’engrais, herbicide et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte.  Elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.

Ce bénéfice permettra de faire face au remboursement de son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The past loan was indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Fatoumata Karim, who is the first person sitting from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, manure, and herbicides and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village at the market. She sells to men and women customers. She plans on making a profit of 90,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to cope with repaying her loan and also to help her big family to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, manure, and herbicides and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, soft cheese, tomatoes, pork rind, etc.

loans.name: Nipagagnon I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe   NIPAGAGNON I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Missirikoro, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leurs deuxièmes prêts avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  Aby debout  en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, l’engrais, herbicide et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte.  Elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 95.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice permettra de faire face au remboursement de son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The ten members of the group "NIPAGAGNON I" are married women averaging 41 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional families in Missirikoro, a village in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work for the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loan was indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Aby, who is the first person standing from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, manure, and herbicides and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village at the market. She sells to men and women customers. She plans on making a profit of 195,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to cope with repaying her loan and also to help her big family to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Anyar Sari 2 Group

texts.en:
Ni Made, a member of her group, wants to increase her business by keeping local pigs, for pig-rolls. 

She needs a new loan to purchase three local pigs and their feed. The pig for pig-roll usually only keeps for two or three months and then is sold. Her husband supports her business by helping her to give feed and by cleaning the cage. 

Ni Made will save her profit because she has a dream to renovate her kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase three local pigs and their feed.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, una humilde comerciante habitante de la ciudad de León, casada, madre de tres hijos, de oficio comerciante. Ella expresa con su anterior crédito le ayudo a surtir de más productos su pulpería, esto le permitió atraer más clientes y mejorar sus ventas antes solo tenía una vitrina ahora tiene dos vitrinas que le sirven para exhibir sus productos, está muy agradecida por permitir que su negocio este creciendo. 
Hoy está necesitando un nuevo financiamiento para comprar arroz, aceite, azúcar, frijoles, huevos y leche al por mayor pues son los productos que más demandan tienen y a diario buscan sus clientes. Pues esto le permitirá mantener a su clientela fiel ofreciéndoles lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Martha, a modest merchant who lives in the city of León, is married and the mother of three children.

She says her previous loan helped her stock more products in her grocery store, which allowed her to attract more customers and improve her sales.  Before she had only one cabinet to display her products and now she has two.  She's very grateful because it's allowing her business to grow.

Currently she needs a new loan to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, eggs, and milk wholesale because they're the products most in demand that her customers look for every day.  Giving her customers what they need will allow her to keep them loyal.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, eggs, and milk

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as committed. She operates a grocery store where she sells bananas, oranges, spinach and other items to earn an income.

She has taken a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a water tank that will benefit directly three members of her family. This will enable them to store and access clean water for domestic use.

In future she wants to be stable and successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en:
Yvette is 37 years old and lives at the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single, and she completed grade 12 and attended a tailoring school. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past four years, she has been operating her own shop in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7 A.M. to 5 P.M. She likes her business because she has more customers. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shared taxi every time to get her goods to her shop.

She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, pepper, coal, etc., for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase oil, pepper, coal, etc for her business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe   BENKADI  sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogame à KADIOLO (Noumousso), un des cercle de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
NAHAWA  en première position de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo, fait le commerce de condiments il ya environ 10 ans, sa renommée en la matière fait d’elle une commerçante très sollicitée. Elle compte acheter 2 bidon d’huile alimentaire, 1 colis de gombo séché, 1 colis de poisson séché et 1 panier de Sounbala.
Elle s’approvisionne en gros au grand marché de Kadiolo ville et de Sikasso.  Sa  clientèle se compose d’hommes et de femmes. Elle vend au marché également à domicile, en détail et au comptant.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 francs CFA dont une partie sera  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The four members of the group "BENKADI" are essentially married women averaging 40 years of age and six children each, living for the most part in monogamous families in KADIOLO (Noumousso), one of the Cercle in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are on their 11th loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. All the previous loans were correctly repaid.

NAHAWA, who is the first person from the left in the photo, has been doing commerce in condiments for about ten years. She is much in demand as a merchant because of her renown in her domain. She intends to purchase 2 containers of cooking oil, a packet of dried okra, a packet of dried fish, and a basket of 'sounbala' (ground and fermented seeds used to flavor dishes). She gets her supplies in bulk at the big markets in Kadiolo City and in Sikasso. Her customer base is composed of men and women. Accepting cash, she sells retail at the market as well as at home. 

She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits will be used to repay the loan with interest, and the other part is for savings.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as oka, cooking oil, and dried fish, to sell

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 25 years old. She sells food such as beans. Her husband is a house constructor. 

The loan will be used to buy more beans for sale. The profits from the loan will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 38 years old. She sells various items in the boutique. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar and salts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and salts for sale.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao, 59-years-old and the married mother of two children, lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province.  She crops rice on two hectares of farmland and this is the single source of income for her family. This business, which she has been engaged in since she was 29-years-old, earns her about 20,000 KHR per day. 

Mao, is a third time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she leads a group of five members to seek new loan. The positive impact of her past loans has enabled her to raise her standard of living. Out of 5,000,000 KHR as the total loan’s amount, Mao, whose loan portion is 1,000,000 KHR, will spend this loan to pay the plowing fee for her farmland and to buy fragrant rice seed for growing. She hopes to gain more yield from her crops so that she can make more income.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee for her farmland and to buy fragrant rice seed to grow.

loans.name: Sonagnon Dénis

texts.fr:
Sonagnon Dénis âgé de 47 ans est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Josephine. Le couple à quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Sonagnon Dénis vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Sonagnon Dénis a très peu  fréquenté l'école. Sonagnon Dénis vend du pain dans sa région et environ depuis une vingtaine années. Sonagnon Dénis s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Sonagnon Dénis sollicite pour la première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sonagnon Dénis is 47 years of age and is married to a retailer named Josephine. The couple has four children, all in school, and three who are dependents. Sonagnon Dénis lives with his wife and children, and together the couple provides for the various household expenses. 

Sonagnon Dénis attended school very little. He has been selling bread in his region and the surrounding area for the past twenty years. Sonagnon Dénis purchases his supplies in the city of Bénin. In order to meet the demand of his customers, Sonagnon Dénis is seeking his first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to purchase bread that he will resell in his region.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 37 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos  hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad, ella tiene un negocio de sala de belleza desde hace 6  años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 8:00 am a 5:00 pm,  tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. juana solicita un credito para poder comprar productos para su sala de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y asi podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Juana is 37 years old and lives with her husband and her two children, who are 18 and 15 years old.  She has had a beauty salon business for 6 years, and works in her home from 8 am to 5 pm.  She has many clients because she is good at what she does, and with the earnings she obtains and with the help of her husband she will be able to take care of home expenses.  

Juana is requesting a loan to be able to buy products for her beauty salon like creams, shampoo, hairpins and scissors among other things that she needs and in this way be able to obtain higher earnings that will help her to have more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoos, hairpins, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Sen's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother of eight children, two of whom are still in school,  Sen is 41 years old and a rice grower. 

Sen farms rice on a 3.5-hectare area during the rainy season and on a twelve-hectare area during the dry season. She has been in her current business for ages. She is able to earn up to KHR 24,000 per day. 

Sen has been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) for the past five cycles and has fully repaid her loans with success. From the previous loans, her living condition has improved. 

Now, in a group of four, Sen is the leader. The total amount of her entire group loan is KHR 4,300,000, of which KHR 1,000,000 is Sen’s portion. 

As the leader, Sen will spend her loan portion to buy good rice seed for replanting her crop. She hopes that she can gain a high yield and make a good profit.

loans.use: to buy good rice seed for replanting her crop.

loans.name: Sreylok's Group

texts.en:
A young mother of three dependent children, residing in Kampong Cham province, Sreylok is an industrious farmer who does rice cropping on a one-hectare area. This business has returned her about KHR 32,800. 

This is the first microloan for Sreylok’s Group, consisting of four female members. The total amount of the group loan is KHR 1,500,000. 

As the leader, whose loan portion is KHR 600,000, Sreylok will use her entire loan to buy good rice seed and potash for her farmland. She strongly believes that she can make more income to expand her agriculture activity on a bigger scale.

loans.use: to buy good rice seed and potash for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Silvia  Gloria

texts.es: Doña Silvia de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, es una mujer  muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una venta de tortillas desde hace 10 años, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. Doña Silvia desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y asi ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Silvia, 64, lives in her own house with her husband and her two children.  She's a very responsible woman whose main priority is to get her family ahead.

She has had a tortilla business for 10 years.  She makes tortillas every afternoon and evening.  Her business is located in her house.  Silvia very much wants to improve her business because it gives her very stable profits, which allows her to support her family.

For this reason she's requesting a loan to buy corn wholesale and lime.  She wants to make a larger quantity of tortillas, especially on the weekend when her demand increases because other tortilla businesses are closed.  This way she can earn more profits to improve her economic stability.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime

loans.name: Samaritain Group

texts.fr: La cliente Buhendwa est membre du groupe d’affaire  «Bon Samaritain», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 38 ans, veuve et mère de 2 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint fut brutalement décédé. La cliente est vendeuse légale de CD, disques, audio cassettes, etc. Elle est sociétaire d’un studio d’Edition. Elle commença ces affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu par sa famille sous forme d’une aide. Il y a 3 ans, elle ouvert cette entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  des CD, disques, audio cassettes, etc. Les coupures intempestives du courant électrique, manque de technologie moderne sont obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Buhendwa, is a member of the business group "Bon Samaritain". A young experienced entrepreneur, she is 38 years old, a widow, and a mother of two children, who are both students. Her husband died violently. This client is a legal vendor of CD's, disks, audiocassettes, etc. She is an associate of an Edition studio. She started this business with funds from her family as a form of assistance. She opened this enterprise three year ago. 

This new loan will be used to purchase CD's, disks, audiocassettes, etc.  The major obstacles in developing her business include power outages during storms and a lack of modern technology. So, she would like to increase her capital, provide schooling to her children, and purchase a plot of land. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-credit support of small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase CD's, disks, audiocassettes, etc. to sell

loans.name: Oem's Group

texts.en:
A mother of seven, Oem is a 52-year-old villager from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. Her one-hectare cassava farm, which is the family's main source of income, yields her about 23,600 KHR per day. The family also receives money from some of her children who work for others.

Oem's previous loan from Kiva's partner VisionFund, which helped support her agribusiness, has been repaid and now, as part of a group of two, she is requesting a new one. She is seeking 500,000 KHR to pay for labor costs involved in spraying insecticide, plowing, and hoeing weeds for her cassava farm, while her co-borrower is applying for 1,200,000 KHR.

Oem hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Doña Flor de 40 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia, ella tiene un negocio de venta de marcos para foto, diplomas y espejos  desde hace vario años trabaja en su lugar de residencia y luego sale a comercializarlos en las diferentes colonias de la zona con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Doña flor  solicita un credito para poder comprar todo lo necesario para la elaboracion de los marcos como: revistas, láminas, bobinas de plástico, etc. para seguir teniendo buenas ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Flor, 40, lives with her husband in her own house.

For several years she has had a business selling frames for photographs, diplomas, and mirrors.  She works in her home and then goes out to sell the frames in different neighborhoods in the area.  With her profits and her husband's help she's able to cover the household expenses.

Flor's requesting a loan to be able to buy everything she needs to make frames, such as magazines, sheets of metal, plastic coils, etc., so she can continue earning good profits and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy magazines, sheets of metal, plastic coils, etc.

loans.name: 30 De Mayo Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es Lidia tiene 64 años de edad, casada, y con un hijo. Su negocio es tener un taller de costura y hace vestidos, faldas, chores y camisas en series y a la medida, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como yardas de telas para faldas, yardas de tela para chores, gruesa de elásticos, gruesa de botones, gruesa encajes, gruesa de agujas, gruesas de zíper etc. Petrona es otra miembro del grupo tiene 53 años y su negocio es también de un taller de costura y bordados por encargos , Socorro tiene una pulpería y su edad es de 61 años y Aurelia su negocio es la venta de pinolillo , frijoles y refrescos.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of four enterprising and successful members.  Lidia, age 64, is one of them.  She is married and has one child.  Her business is her seamstress shop.  She makes dresses, skirts, shorts, and shirts en mass and custom made.

She will use this loan to buy raw material like yards of fabric for skirts, yards of fabric for shorts, and elastic, buttons, lace, needles, and zippers, etc. by the gross.

Petrona, age 53, is another member of the group.  Her business is also a seamstress shop where she sews and embroiders by order.  Socorro, age 61, has a grocery store.  Aurelia has a business of selling ‘pinolillo’ [a sweet cornmeal and cacao-based traditional drink in Nicaragua], beans, and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing.

loans.name: Ten's Group

texts.en:
Ten, a villager from Kampong Cham province, is 46 years old and married. She is blessed with seven children, four of whom are still in school, while the remaining three are workers at a rubber plantation, owned by a private company in the local area. 

To strive for a living, Ten also works as a latex tapper and her husband works as construction worker. She is able to generate about KHR 19,000 per day from the occupation that she has had for ages. 

Ten, a third-cycle client, joins the same group with another borrower who is a second-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) to apply for a new loan. Ten has been successful in repaying her past loan, which enabled her to provide, three times a day, decent meals for her children. 

For this cycle, Ten is seeking KHR 1,400,000 and her joint member is applying for KHR 1,200,000. As the leader, Ten will spend her portion to buy a decent motorbike for her children to commute back and forth to the workplace. She hopes that her children can reduce the transportation cost that they used to have and can use that money to support the family, instead.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her children.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Shally

texts.en:
Shally is a 37-year-old married woman with two children; she lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  She manages a buy and sell business selling candles in the market. She has been doing this for ten years. 

In 2006, she joined GDMPC and recently requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional working inventory capital like assorted candles, flowers and vases.  

She plans to engage in another line of business, like selling flowers, to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase additional working inventory capital like assorted candles, flowers and vases.

loans.name: Thach's Group

texts.en:
Thach, a citizen from the Sangke district of Battambang province, is growing rice and working as a labor. She is 52 years old and a mother of seven children. For 20 years involvement in the current business, she manages to earn about 68,100 KHR per day to support her family’s daily cost.
With VisionFund(Kiva’s partner), she is the seventh-time borrower. She has completed repaid back her past loan already which has improved her lifestyle to be better than before. Now she and her one group member are applying for a new. Her loan amount is 1,400,000KHR and another one member is 1,000,000KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and some crop seed to extent her business. She hopes she can get high crop yield to get a better standard life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and some crop seed to extent her business

loans.name: Endang

texts.en:
Endang runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. Endang lives in Bogor, a semi-urban area about one hour from Jakarta. She is married and living with three persons in the family home. 

Endang began working with Ruma one and a half months ago because she wanted to increase her income by selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last one and a half months, she has had around $30 - 35/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Fadil

texts.en:
Fadil lives in Bogor, about one hour from Jakarta.  Bogor is known as a rainy city. Fadil manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit.  Fadil is married and living with his daughter and wife in the family home. His child is just one month old.

Fadil joined Ruma two months ago because he wanted to sell new products. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Fadil sees improvements in his shop. For the last two months, he has been earning an average of $50 - 55/day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. His goal for his business is to expand into more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe   SABALY sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogame à KADIOLO (Noumousso), un des cercle de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
SALY   en position au milieu sur la photo, fait le commerce de condiments il ya environ 11 ans, sa renommée en la matière fait d’elle une commerçante très sollicitée et appréciée. 
Elle compte acheter 2 sacs d’oignon, 1 carton de concentrée de tomate et 1 paquets de cubes maggi. Elle s’approvisionne à Kadiolo ville et de Sikasso.  Sa  clientèle se compose d’hommes et de femmes. Elle vend à domicile et au marché, en détail, au comptant et à crédit.
Elle  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 500 francs CFA dont une partie sera  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The six members of the Sabaly Group are mainly married women with an average age of 40 years and an average of six children. They live for the most part in monogamous families in Kadiolo (Noumousso), one of the circles of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. The group is on their fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and all of their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Saly, shown in the center of the photo, has been a merchant of condiments (vegetables sauces) for about 11 years. Her reputation in her field makes her a highly sought after and popular merchant. With this loan, she intends to buy two sacks of onions, one carton of tomato paste and one packet of Maggi (bouillon) cubes. Saly purchases her supplies in the city of Kadiolo and Sikasso. Her clientele is composed of men and women. She retails her goods from her home and at the market, for cash and on credit.

Saly hopes to earn an average monthly income of 25,500 Francs CFA, part of which will be used to repay her loan and its interest, and the remainder of which will go into her savings. Saly aims to increase her sales turnover so that she can better serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase condiments (ingredients for making vegetable sauces)

loans.name: Ascencia

texts.es:
Ascencia continua viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde realiza todo tipo de actividades, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria los días domingos en la ciudad de Huancarani. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo carnes, verduras, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, carne y otras cosas más.

Ascencia continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ascencia still lives in the city of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo, where she does all types of jobs.  She still makes a living selling food as a street vendor on Sundays in the city of Huancarani.  She has done this job for several years now and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

This time she needs a loan to buy more supplies such as meat, vegetables, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other things.

Ascencia continues with Mamacha Rosario Communal Bank in Asociación Arariwa.  She's grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy food supplies

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Doña blanca de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Blanca is 48 years old, lives in her own house with her two children, and has a shop where she sells staple goods like beans, milk, eggs, and bread, among others.  She has spent many years with her business and this has given her sales experience that allows her to get better profits.  It is located in her home, in a very busy town.  Her business is well-known by the neighbors in the area and she has many customers since she has the store well-stocked.  

She wants to increase the business and make a new investment but she needs the capital.  This is why she asks for a loan that allows her to buy what she needs for the store.  She is certain that she can pay off the debt and at the same time believes that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, oil, eggs, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Javier Eduardo

texts.es: Javier reside en la ciudad de Portoviejo – Ecuador, su negocio es la compra y venta de artículos plásticos para el hogar, este negocio lo inicio el Padre de Javier, quien después de un tiempo le cedió la administración, esta actividad la realiza de martes a viernes para lo cual alquila un vehículo y lo acompaña el papá, el objetivo del préstamo es realizar la compra de productos plásticos; su sueño es tener un almacén para poder tener mas mercadería, terminar de construirla casa de sus padres.
texts.en: Javier lives in the city of Portoviejo, Ecuador.  His business is buying and selling plastic items for the home.  The business was started by Javier’s father who after some time passed on its management to him.  He works Tuesday to Friday and to do so rents a vehicle and his father accompanies him.  The objective of the loan is to buy plastic items.  His dream is to have a store and to stock more merchandise and to finish building his parents’ house.

loans.use: to buy plastic items.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro reside en la ciudad de Portoviejo – Ecuador, su negocio es la venta de ropa en un local del centro de la ciudad donde  le ayudan sus familiares, obtuvo la experiencia por parte de sus familiares y luego decidió emprender su actividad hace aproximadamente 40 año,  hace cinco años logro obtener un local en la bahía de la ciudad de Portoviejo, donde atiende desde las 09:00 hasta las 17:00, en un futuro desea tener un local que tenga parqueadero de vehículos, con el préstamo desea comprar mas camisetas y pantalonetas.
texts.en: Pedro lives in the city of Portoviejo, Ecuador.  His business is selling clothes in a locale in city center where his family members help him.  He got the experience from some of his family members and then decided about 40 years ago to start his own business.  Five years ago he succeeded in obtaining a local in the city of Portoviejo’s bay where he’s open for business from 9am until 5pm.  In future he’d like to have a locale with parking.  He wants to use the loan to buy more t-shirts and shorts.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts and shorts.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 36-year-old married man from a small village near Jenin city. He lives with his wife and eight children: five sons and three daughters. He works in Israel and earns a low income. It is not steady work because of the check points. He would like to start his own taxi business near his family. Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the costs of insurance and licensing his taxi. Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the costs of insurance and licensing his taxi

loans.name: Jose Abrahan

texts.es: Don jose vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol  y adicional a esto al cultivo de hortalizas, tiene 10 años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde siembra esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; don jose es un hombre activo, entregado a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, piensa trabajar con esfuerzo y constancia para no rendirse en el camino; desea realizar  una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herramientas, etc. don jose  tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
José lives in his own house with his wife and five children.  He works growing corn and beans and also grows vegetables.  He’s been working in agriculture for ten years and has gained valuable experience that makes it possible for him to obtain the best crops.  The land he farms is located in an area of heavy agricultural concentration that’s very near his house.  He sells in all the areas surrounding the community and has acquired a large clientele that prefers him because everything he sells is of first quality at affordable prices with good service.

José is an active man who is devoted to his work and who very much wants to get ahead.  He’s always on the lookout for opportunities that will allow him to reach success.  He intends to work hard and consistently and not give up along the way.  He wants to make a new investment to increase production and this is why he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, manure, insecticide, tools, etc.  José has good payment references and is sure to repay the loan while at the same time is confident that he’ll provide his home with economic security.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and tools.

loans.name: Sèvèho Sévérin

texts.fr: Sèvèho Sévérin, âgé de 28 ans,  est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Fifamè. Le couple à deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sèvèho Sévérin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Sèvèho Sévérin a très peu fréquenté l'école mais a appris la mécanique. Sèvèho Sévérin achète des motos au Nigéria pour les revendre à son domicile depuis huit ans. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande croissante de sa clientèle, Sèvèho Sévérin sollicite pour la première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sèvèho Sévérin, aged 28, is married to a retailer named Fifamè. The couple has two children, both of whom are in school and are their dependents. Sèvèho Sévérin lives with his wife and children, and together the couple provides for the various household expenses.

Sèvèho Sévérin has very little formal education but learned to be a mechanic. Sèvèho Sévérin purchases motorcycles in Nigeria to resell from his home, which he has been doing for eight years. In order to meet his growing customer demand, Sèvèho Severin is seeking his first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycles in Nigeria to resell from his home.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en: Jalia  is married and has four children, all whom go to school.  She also takes care of  her mother. She has a business selling mattress covers and bed sheets.  She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of mattress covers and bed sheets.  She has been in this clothing business for eight years and works at the market six days out of every week and sells on retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include   transportation and seasonality.  She aspires to import used clothes and also to build rental houses. She  resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of mattress covers and bed sheets.

loans.name: Martina Hilda

texts.es:
Martina, dueña de una pulpería expresa su agradecimiento por el apoyo que recibió al ser beneficiada con su crédito anterior el cual le permitió comprar productos para vender en su pulpería negocios muy populares y de ingresos diarios en la ciudad de León además que son de mucha necesidad entre la población de bajos ingresos. 
Actualmente doña Martina requiere de este financiamiento para comprar vitrinas para exhibir sus productos y tenerlos en mejores condiciones también para comprar granos básicos que son de consumo diario entre su clientela.
texts.en:
Martina owns a grocery store.  She expresses her thanks for the support she got when she was granted her previous loan that made it possible for her to buy popular products to sell in her grocery store and earn daily income in the city of León; besides they are very much needed among the low-income population.

Currently, Martina needs this loan to buy display cases to exhibit her products and have them in better conditions and also to buy basic grains that her customers consume daily.

loans.use: to buy display cases.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres,  se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol y adicional a esto siembra hortalizas, tomates, chiles y ayote, tiene mas de 20 años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde siembra esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; francisco desea realizar  una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herramientas, etc. para obtener mejores cosechas y asi tener una mejor estabilidad económica con sus padres.
texts.en:
Francisco, 48, lives with his parents in his own house.  He works in agriculture growing corn and beans and also vegetables like tomatoes, chilies and squash.  He has been working in agriculture for more than 20 years and has gained valuable experience that makes it possible for him to obtain the best crops.  The land he farms is in an area of high agricultural concentration that’s very near his house.  He sells all around his community and has obtained a large clientele that prefers him because everything he sells is top quality at affordable prices with good service.

Francisco wants to make a new investment that will lead to increased production which is why he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, fertilizer, pest control, tools, etc. to obtain better crops so that he and his parents can have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and tools.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani y donde realiza sus actividades personales, económicas y familiares, ella continua con la venta de comida y con la agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo fideos, azúcar, verduras, carne, arroz, aceite y otras cosas más. 

Alejandrina continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina continues living in the city of Huancarani where she carries out her personal, family and business activities.  She continues to sell food and farm.  She has been doing this work for a number of years and is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Alejandrina needs a loan to buy more basic household products such as noodles, sugar, vegetables, meat, rice, oil, etc.

Alejandrina still belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Mamacha Rosario" community bank.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving and pledges to make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy more basic household products such as noodles, sugar, vegetables, meat, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente tiene un taller de enderezado y pintura desde hace varios años, vive con su compañera de vida  en casa de un familiar es un hombre muy trabajador responsable, honesto y honrado, tienen mucha clientela pues lo prefieren por su buen trabajo y los precios realmente accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos que tiene en su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pinturas, esmaltes para vehiculos, herramientas, y todo lo necesario para seguir con su trabajo y así tener una mejor calidad de vida con su compañera de vida.
texts.en:
The client has had a bodywork and painting workshop for several years.  He lives with his life partner in a family member's house.  He's a very hardworking, responsible, honest, and honorable man.  He has a lot of customers who prefer him because of his good work and truly affordable prices.  With his profits he's able to pay some of his household expenses.

The client's requesting a loan to buy paint, car varnish, tools, and everything he needs to continue doing his job and have a better quality of life with his life partner.

loans.use: to buy paint, car varnish, tools, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As an immigrant to the U.S., Maria is no stranger to hard work and ambition.  At 15, she and her family moved from Guatemala to El Salvador and then the US, searching to fulfill their dreams of self-sustainability and a better life. 

Years later, during the hardest part of the U.S. recession, every member of her family lost their jobs, and Maria was the only member of her family left with a full-time job.  She felt blessed for her opportunity, but wanted a way to help her family further.  As a single mother of two daughters, Maria also wanted to have time for her daughters to teach them the work ethic and values imparted to her. 
 
Maria used her business sense and skills to develop a business model that would address all of her family needs and help her achieve her personal goals.  Her motto has been, “You can always do more.  You can make money doing the right thing.”  Following her motto, she started her own business, Mayan Commercial and Residential Cleaning Services, in June 2012. 
 
Since then, Maria has been able to employ her family members, spend more time with her daughters and expand her business to cover three large commercial locations, servicing over 35,000 ft of retail space.  Maria shares that she enjoys the challenge, and that her deep commitment to integrity and her ambition to provide a better life for her family is what motivates her to succeed.  

Maria’s Kiva loan will be used to purchase a commercial carpet cleaning machine, which will enable her business to service large, retail flooring locations and provide an additional service to her growing clientele.  With your help, Maria can continue to make a positive impact on her family and her community.

“I’m so thankful for Kiva, and for the opportunities that Kiva lenders create.  To each of you, thank you for what you do.” – Maria, Mayan Commercial and Residential Cleaning Services

loans.use: to purchase a commercial carpet cleaning machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to upgrade his current water pressure system, complete vehicle repairs, and pay his part-time employee.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a permanent resident of Rugando in the western region of Uganda, married with seven children and 2 dependents of his brother who died of cancer five years ago. He grew up with only his mother as his father was not known to him, which made his life difficult. 

Being pushed by the need to survive and to support his mother, he started banana farming on a small scale on the land he got from his grandmother. This banana plantation was used as a source of food for the family and income for their survival. This business has grown, giving him an opportunity to support his family and dependents. He also managed to construct a house for his family. He is requesting a loan of UGX.4,000,000 to complete the house. He is excited that soon he will be in a position to house his children in modest accommodations.In the photo is Denis with his wife who signed the waiver form.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Sarhad

texts.en:
Sarhad is a man of 54 years. Currently he is married. His wife is a housewife and she also helps Sarhad with the farm work. They have four children, ages 29, 26, 21 and 17.

Sarhad learned farm work from the time he was a child. His father imparted to him the practical knowledge of work in everything related to agriculture. Later he made it his everyday work so as to always be able to support his household. For 22 years he has been farming and raising cattle for milk production. His wife is a great help in this activity. When Sarhad goes out to sell, she feeds the animals or prepares the land where the crops are. In addition, Sarhad works as an accountant at the local supermarket and earns a salary there. 

The reason he is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN is to purchase materials like cables and wire for the installation of electricity in his home. His dream is to improve his housing condition by applying finishes in his home and building a retaining wall. Sarhad is grateful to those who, through Kiva, can be part of this growth in his life, and he encourages them to continue supporting the business ventures of people who, like him, dream of having a better quality of life in their households.

loans.use: To purchase materials like cables and wire for the installation of electricity in his home.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Huancarani y donde realiza sus actividades personales y económicas, ella continua  dedicándose a la cosecha, cultivo y a vender cereales como   por ejemplo trigo, cebada, moraya seca, maíz y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Celia requiere el préstamo para compra semillas y abonos, pues continua en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Celia continues living in the city of Huancarani, in Huancarani province.  This is where she carries out her personal and business activities.  She continues growing, harvesting and selling cereals such as wheat, barley, 'moraya' (freeze-dried potato), corn, etc.  She has been in this business for a number of years and is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Celia needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  She still belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Mamacha Rosario" community bank and is grateful for the opportunity she is being given.  She pledges to make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en: Khim is 35 years old and a local villager from Kandal Province. She takes care of one daughter who is still in school. Nowadays, the household income consists of her wages working at a factory and the rice farming business managed by her husband. She helps with the family’s business during her spare time. She has been involved in this business for five years. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Khim has taken out four loans and repaid back her past loans with success. She wisely utilized her previous loans to support her business and make good progress. Now, she leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. Khim, the group leader, will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed, insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes that she can produce a good crop and make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando es una persona trabajadora y joven. Tiene su esposa y un niño de 5 años. Actualmente Orlando vive junto a su familia en una zona marginada de Cochabamba. Viven en su propia vivienda que adquirieron hace unos años, fruto del trabajo que realizan con el servicio de transporte. Actualmente Orlando necesita terminar de construir su vivienda, ya que aun no tiene los requerimientos básicos para que su vivienda mantenga las condiciones saludables donde su pequeño hijo y familia puedan llevar una vida digna. Entre sus planes futuros Orlando planea obtener un nuevo préstamo para amurallar su domicilio puesto que actualmente no tiene muralla.
texts.en: Orlando is a hard-working young man who is married and has a 5-year-old son.  The family currently lives in a poor area of Cochabamba in their own home that they managed to buy a few years ago as a result of Orlando's work providing a transport service.  Orlando currently needs to finish building his home as the house still doesn't meet the basic requirements for his young son and family to lead a decent life in a healthy environment.  Orlando's future plans include taking out a further loan to build a wall around his home as it currently doesn't have one.

loans.use: to carry out building work on his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beds, chairs, and other items.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en: Heng, age 54 and a widow, is a citizen from the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. She has three children, two of whom are helping the family’s businesses. Heng makes a living by farming one and half hectares of rice as her primary business. She earns supplemental income by selling Cambodian noodles and catching fish for resale. The businesses she has operated for 12 years earns her about 19,700 KHR per day. She is a seven-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loans have been fully repaid, enabling her to provide sufficient food for her kids. Now, Heng leads a group of five to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will use a portion of her loan to buy fishing equipment and to fix her boat. She believes that she can triple her income so as she can upgrade her lifestyle even better than before.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment and to fix her boat

loans.name: Ana Maricar

texts.en: Ana Maricar is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four children. Ana Maricar has been engaged in farming for more than five years now as the only the source of income. Ana Maricar is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to grow healthy crops thus allowing her to augment her harvest. In the future, Ana Maricar hopes to expand her farming business and make it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Isvelia

texts.es: La señora Isvelia vive en la población de Manco Kapac con su concubino. La señora Isvelia trabaja junto con su conyugué dedicándose al área agrícola, trabajan en su terreno propio, este terreno lo adquirieron con mucho esfuerzo después de  2 años de trabajo duro,  en este terreno producen piña y yuca, la comercialización la realiza a los intermediarios que generalmente vienen a comprar al lugar donde se cosecha el producto. La producción de piña va creciendo en el  lugar y genera buenos ingresos económicos, para ello la señora Isvelia y su concubino requieren el crédito para comprar plantines de piña para poder ampliar su producción, con este crédito la señora Isvelia podrá ser capaz de cumplir sus metas propuestas,  seguir creciendo económicamente y ser una de las productoras de piña reconocidas en la zona.
texts.en: Isvelia lives in the town of Manco Kapac with her spouse.  She and her spouse work together in agriculture on land of their own that they acquired with much effort after two years of hard work.  They grow pineapple and manioc on their land and sell it to middlemen that come by their place.  The pineapple production is growing in the place and generates good income and this is why Isvelia and her spouse need the loan to buy pineapple seedlings to expand production.  With this loan, Isvelia will be capable of meeting her set goals, to continue to grow economically and to be one of the most well-known pineapple producers in the zone.

loans.use: to buy pineapple seedlings.

loans.name: Mab's Group

texts.en: Mab is in his late 40s and is the father of seven children. He grows rice on two hectares and has had the business for 10 years. It earns him about 14,200 KHR per day to meet the expenses of his entire household. Mab has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loans and has repaid them completely, managing to improve his standard of living. Now he is leading a group of three to apply for a new loan. The total amount of his group's loan is 3,200,000 KHR, of which 1,200,000 KHR is his portion. Mab will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer and to hire a laborer to plow his farmland. He expects to increase his income better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire a laborer to plow his farmland

loans.name: Ath's Group

texts.en: Ath is the father of one son and resides in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Ath farms rice on three hectares of land as his main source of income. He is able to earn up to 13,500 KHR per day from the business which he has had for two years. He took out a previous loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) which he has repaid back completely. The loan has supported his rice cultivation. Now, Ath leads a group of four to apply for a new loan. He will spend his requested loan amount to buy four sacks of potash and to pay the plowing fee. He believes that he can make more income to expand his business at a bigger scale than before.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of potash and to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is 42 years old and a mother of two children. She and the rest of her family are residing in Kandal province’s Sa Ang district. 

She makes a living via pole bean planting. The 22 years' engagement in the current business enables her to generate about KHR 13,300 per day. 

Twice, Chantha has taken a microloan from VisionFund Cambodia and has fully repaid them. The past loan has kept up a good pace of her business and has improved her living conditions progressively. 

Now, she is taking a new loan of KHR 2,200,000 in order to make poles for her beans and to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops. She hopes to earn more income, so she can set aside some money for her future needs.

loans.use: to make poles for her beans and to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops.

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe  BENKELEMA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37  ans, 6 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogame à KADIOLO (Noumousso) un des cercle de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
KOROTOUMOU en position debout et au milieu sur la photo, fait la restauration   il ya environ 7 ans, sa renommée en la matière fait d’elle une restauratrice très sollicitée. 
Elle s’approvisionne en matière première (céréales et condiments) à Kadiolo ville et souvent dans les villages avoisinants. Elle détient une gargote à Kadiolo ville. Sa  clientèle se compose d’hommes et de femmes. Elle vend ses plats alimentaires  en détail et au comptant dans sa gargote et à domicile.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The majority of the six members of the BENKELEMA group are married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have six children each.  Most of them live in monogamous families in Kadiolo (Noumousso), one of the districts of Sikasso (third-largest administrative division of Mali).  They are on their eleventh loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and have duly repaid all their previous loans.

Korotoumou, the featured borrower, has been preparing meals for about seven years.  In the photo, she is standing in the middle of the group.  She is well-known in her field and receives many orders.

She buys her supplies (grains and condiments) in the town of Kadiolo and also often stocks up in the surrounding villages.  She owns a very small restaurant in the town of Kadiolo and serves meals to both men and women.  She sells her meals for cash and on a retail basis in her small restaurant and also from home.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest while the rest will be saved.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of meals.

loans.name: Bugambilias San Pablo Group

texts.es:
La señora Ignacia Domitila es madre soltera, tiene 52 años de edad, su escolaridad es primaria, tiene 1 hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, inició este negocio comprando poca mercadería y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Decide organizar un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de más mercadería y asi poder surtir su venta y generar mayor ganancia, en el futuro quiere ver su negocio prospero; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de ropa y molino de nixtamal.
texts.en:
Ignacia Domitila is 52 years old. She has a primary school education and is a single mother with one son. She works selling clothing, and started her business by purchasing a small amount of merchandise and now has ten years of experience.

She has decided to start a group and is applying for a loan that will be used to purchase more merchandise to increase her stock for sale as well as her profits. In the future, she would like to see her business thrive. The other members of her group earn their livings selling clothing and grinding cornmeal for tortillas.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothing.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El señor Miguel trabaja como agricultor en una parte de terreno que su padre le proporcionó,  cultiva sus productos para después comercializarlo en el mercado de la población; por otro lado cuando no trabaja en su terreno le ayuda a su pareja en la venta de sus abarrotes donde venden de lunes a domingo sin parar ni un día, tiene un bebito al que mantienen con ambos trabajos, el dinero que está solicitando es para poder agrandar su tienda de abarrotes y para que puedan generar un poco mas de ingreso y así puedan sacar adelante a su pequeño hijito.
texts.en: Miguel works in agriculture on a part of a piece of land his father gave him; he grows his products to subsequently sell them in the local market.  On the other hand, when he’s not working the land he helps his spouse to sell groceries Monday to Sunday with no days off.  He has a baby they support by means of both jobs.  The money he’s asking for is to be able to enlarge his grocery store so that they can generate a bit more income and be able to move their little boy ahead.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Tyrone

texts.en:
Tyrone began Innovations Valid Photo Concepts two months ago in Memphis, Tennessee.  A photography, videography and production company that offers clients custom framed photographs, short movie productions for YouTube, and video recording services.

Tyrone discovered Accion Texas Inc. while watching the morning television show, Good Morning Memphis.  He took the necessary steps to apply and received a $5,450 loan.  The loan allowed Tyrone to continue to photograph weddings and parties with the few supplies he purchased with the loan money.  Tyrone is using his loan money to rent office space for the next six months, purchase updated camera equipment, film, and retain his one full-time employee.  Tyrone believes in great customer service and guarantees the best experience or your money back.  He believes he is hired to do the best job he possibly can during the special moments of his clients lives.  

Without the Accion loan he would still be utilizing his existing equipment and holding off to rent an office space.  The new equipment purchased has allowed Tyrone to step up to the demands of his business and offer better quality services, video, and photographs.

loans.use: to rent office space for the next six months, purchase updated camera equipment, film, and retain his one full-time employee.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe SOUTOURA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37  ans, et en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogame à KADIOLO (Noumousso) un des cercle de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
ALIMA  en position debout et au milieu sur la photo, fait le commerce de tissus et des parures il ya environ 11 ans, sa renommée en la matière fait d’elle une commerçante très sollicitée. 
Elle compte acheter, 10 pièces de pagnes wax et quelques colis de parures. Elle s’approvisionne  à Kadiolo ville et souvent à Sikasso. Elle fait le commerce ambulant à Kadiolo ville. Sa  clientèle se composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle vend également à domicile.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie sera  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The majority of the seven members of the SOUTOURA group are married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have six children each. Most of them live in monogamous families in Kadiolo (Noumousso), one of the districts of Sikasso (third-largest administrative division of Mali). They are on their fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and have duly repaid all their previous loans.

Alima, the featured borrower, has been selling fabrics and jewelry for about 11 years.  She is well-known in her field and receives many orders.  In the photo, she is in the standing row, in the middle of the group. 

She plans to buy 10 sets of wax "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) and a few boxes containing jewelry.  She buys her goods in Kadiolo and also often stocks up in Sikasso.  She sells door to door in the town of Kadiolo and her customers are men and women.  She also sells from home.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest while the rest will be used to strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and jewelry.

loans.name: Enongninmon Antoine

texts.fr: Enongninmon Antoine, 49 ans, est marié à une revendeuse nommée Justine. Le couple à cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Enongninmon Antoine vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Enongninmon Antoine a très peu fréquenté l'école mais a appris la soudure. En plus de ses activités de soudures, Enongninmon Antoine vend également des tôles dans sa région depuis huit ans. Enongninmon Antoine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande grandissante de sa clientèle, Enongninmon Antoine sollicite pour la cinquième  fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.  Les prêts antérieurs ont tous été remboursés en temps et en heure.
texts.en: Enongninmon Antoine, 49, is married to a reseller named Justine. The couple has five children, all who attend school and who are in their care. Enongninmon Antoine lives with his wife and his children. The couple shares the various household expenses. Enongninmon Antoine has had very little schooling but has learned to weld. In addition to his welding, Enongninmon Antoine has also been selling sheet metal in his area for eight years. Enongninmon Antoine stocks up in a market in Benin. In the goal of satisfying the growing needs of his clientele, Enongninmon Antoine is seeking for a fifth time, financial support from ALIDé. His previous loans have all been properly repaid on time.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and accessories for welding

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place like canned goods and noodles among others. This is the source of her income. Florencia is asking for a loan to buy more stock of items like canned goods, soda, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her stock and attract more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items like canned goods, soda, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of three young children. 

She has been in the rice farming business for more than five years now. This is the source of their income. 

Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. 

In the future, Lourdes hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Khatija

texts.en:
Khatija is a 53-year-old woman, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has three children and, for 15 years, her husband has been operating an automobile workshop. They are facing financial problems due to low monthly income.

Khatija has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. She wants to invest in her husband’s business, so that their income and savings would be increased. The main purpose of the loan is for her husband to buy new tools for repairing and tuning automobiles. His customer base would be increased, if he had the latest equipment and tools. 

In the future, with the profit amount, he wants to expand his workshop by adding some more space to it. Khatija is very hopeful that this loan could solve many problems for her family and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for her husband's automobile workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Talshica

texts.en:
For eight years, Talshica has offered her services as a professional hair care attendant. As she continues to juggle her business and her side job, Talshica’s main focus is providing professional help for those without healthy hair. 

At her business, New Growth Hair Care, Talshica takes hair at all levels -- thin, split, broken and even healthy – and treats it to an improved level of care from her storefront, and oftentimes, in client’s homes.

Gaining clients from fliers, social groups, friends, family, and from advice given to potential clients, Talshica says more than half of her clients are returning clients. 

To expand her business, Talshica ventured to Accion Texas Inc. after learning about the nonprofit microlender from the Small Business Development Center in her hometown of Baton Rouge. A $5,450 loan helped the 32-year-old purchase sinks, chairs, dyers, and a receptionist desk and chair.

Though Talshica has many years of experience, she is at the beginning of her next stage of her business. She says after the additions to the store are made, she plans to add hire one full-time and three part-time employees. She also plans to become a wholesaler for the products she uses to increase business.

loans.use: to purchase sinks, chairs, dyers, and a receptionist desk and chair.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es: Maria vive con su esposo y su hijo de 14 años de edad. Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; María es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene una actitud de ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia, ella piensa que cuando alguien desea algo debe saber que corre riesgos y por eso la vida vale la pena, quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. María tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and 14-year-old son.  She owns a tortilla shop that’s very well-known in the community where she lives.  She has many customers because she sells the best, nice and hot, tortillas and service is very fast and prices are truly affordable.

María is an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  He has a winning attitude which is what always keeps her ahead of the competition.  She thinks that when someone wants something she must be aware that there are risks involved but life is worth it.  She wants to run this risk in order to make her business grow and that’s why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn at wholesale.  María hopes in this way to bring economic security home and a fulfilled life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Kobanka Group

texts.fr:
Mme BRIGITTE représente le groupe  KOBANKA. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 05ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 01an. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes de pagnes au grand marché. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 10pagnes.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de pagne et aider ses enfants pour leur avenir.
texts.en: Mrs. Brigitte represents the KOBANKA group. She is a married mother of two. The eldest is 5 and the youngest is 2. None of her children attend school and she has four people in her care. Mrs. Brigitte has been selling pagnes (traditional cloth wraps) for a year. She stocks up with pagne wholesalers at the big market. Her customers are men and women. She wants to buy ten pagnes. Mrs. Brigitte wants to save her earnings. She aspires to open a pagne boutique and help her children with their future.

loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes

loans.name: Zanga Group

texts.fr:
Mme P.JEANNE MARIE représente le groupe  ZANGA. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 15ans. 02 vont à l’école.
Mme fait la restauration depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les voisins et amis.
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de riz et 10 plats d’arachide.
Mme veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son restaurant et aider son mari pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mrs. P.JEANNE MARIE represents the ZANGA group. She is a married mother of four. The eldest is 21 and the youngest is 15. Two of her children attend school. Mrs. P.JEANNE MARIE has been in the restaurant business for 10 years. She stocks up at the neighborhood market. Her customers are neighbors and friends. She wants to buy two sacks of rice and ten plates of peanuts. Mrs. P.JEANNE MARIE wants to strengthen her business with her earnings. She aspires to grow her restaurant and help her husband pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of rice and 10 plates of peanuts

loans.name: Dwarsani Group

texts.en:
