In the year 2009, four rural tribal women from Baddohel village of Nuapada district in Odisha, India formed a group named Dwarsani to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their business. Sumitra is one of them. The lady standing second from the left in the photo raising her hand is Sumitra; aged 30, she is a very poor tribal lady, and lives with her husband and her nephew. Her family belongs to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) category. People from the BPL category live on less than one dollar a day.

Sumitra has been running a general store in her small village for last 12 years. Her nephew supplements in her business. She sells general grocery items like oil, sugar, lentils, biscuits, soft drinks (sodas) and stationery such as books, pens, etc. Sumitra was able to increase the variety of items at her general store with her scanty savings and increase her cash flow. 

Her monthly income from the existing business is 6000 Indian Rupees (INR). Out of this income she has been able to manage her household expenses and spent some income for construction of a small shop cabin. As per the statement she was able to increase the variety of items in her shop but not the inventory. She wants to increase stock of her business. So the loan amount will be utilized to purchase items like lentils, oil, dal, soap, biscuits, potatoes etc. in bulk for her general store. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she will replenish her stock less frequently. Sumitra hopes to save enough for building a good house for her family as the present house is very small and congested.

The other three members of the group are Pramila, Jamuna and Kumari who are running a tyre repairing center, a general shop and a goat business respectively.

loans.use: To buy lentils, oil, dal, soap, biscuits, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: Rafia is a 47-year-old hardworking woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons, and three daughters. All of her children are studying in school. She and her husband have owned a fast food business for five years, which is the only source of income for their family. Now for the further growth of their business Rafia has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase some crockery and chairs for the restaurant. Since their family expenditures are much higher than their monthly income and savings she wants to open a new shop for her husband with the profit amount. As a result, they can increase their monthly income and savings. She dreams for the higher education of her children. She is very thankful to Kiva for such a great help and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for restaurant

loans.name: Fidèle's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de sept personnes résident dans le même quartier.
La représentante du groupe, nommée Fidèle (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 29 ans, elle est mariée à un maçon avec lequel elle a eu trois enfants. 
Contrairement à Fidèle qui n’a été à l’école, tous ses enfants sont scolarisés.
Afin d’assurer les charges de la famille avec son mari, Fidèle vend des chaussures dans sa région depuis sept ans. 
Régulièrement, elle s'approvisionne dans un marché de sa ville pour revendre chez elle au détail.
Au vu de la demande croissante de ses clients, Fidèle s’est regroupé avec d’autres personnes de son voisinage pour solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. 
Les prêts antérieurs ont tous bien été remboursés en temps et en heure.
texts.en:
This group comprises seven members who all live in the same neighborhood.  Fidèle, the group's representative, is 29 years old and married to a mason with whom she has had three children.  In the photo, she is the woman raising her hand.

Unlike Fidèle, who did not attend school, all her children are in school.

In order to jointly take care of the family's expenses with her husband, Fidèle has been selling shoes, in her region, for the past seven years.

She regularly stocks up at one of her town's markets and resells from home on a retail basis.  As the demand from her customers is increasing, she has formed a group with other women from her neighborhood in order to request a third loan from ALIDé.  All previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Dagbozounkou Dénagan

texts.fr:
Dagbozounkou Dénagan est âgé de 50 ans, il vit avec sa femme Houmè et leur 5 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés.
Il partage avec sa femme, qui fait du petit commerce, les charges de sa famille.

Dagbozounkou Dénagan a très peu fréquenté l'école mais il a développé une grande expertise dans la maçonnerie qu'il exerce depuis 15 ans maintenant. 
Aujourd'hui Dagbozounkou Dénagan fait appel à ALIDé, pour la troisième fois, afin d'acheter des matériaux au marché pour construire des clôtures pailles (claies)afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.
Son grand dynamisme fait la force de son activité et est reconnu par tous.

Tous ses prêts antérieurs ont bien été remboursés.
texts.en:
Dagbozounkou Dénagan is 50 years old and lives with his wife Houmè and their five children, who all attend school. He pays for his family’s expenses with his wife, who runs a small business.

Dagbozounkou Dénagan has had very little schooling but has developed a strong expertise in masonry, which he has been doing for 15 years. Today Dagbozounkou Dénagan seeks the help of ALIDé for the third time in order to buy materials from the market to construct wire fences in order to satisfy his clientele. His energy drives his business and is recognized by everyone.

All of his previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy materials to develop his masonry business

loans.name: Sèssimè's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de trois femmes qui résident dans le même quartier. 
Elles ont décidé de se réunir pour prendre chacune un premier prêt auprès d'ALIDé afin de développer leur activité respective.

La représentante du groupe, Sèssimè (au milieu de la photo avec la main levée) est âgée de 41 ans. 
Elle est mariée avec Antoine et a eu quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés.

Pour assurer les charges de la famille avec son mari qui est commerçant, Sèssimè s'approvisionne en maïs et boissons locales dans un marché de sa ville pour les revendre à son domicile depuis trois ans.

Bien qu'elle n'ait pas fréquentée l’école, elle est connue pour la bonne gestion de son activité.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood. They decided to come together to take their first loan with ALIDé in order to develop their respective businesses.

The representative of the group, Sèssimè (in the middle of the photo with her hand raised), is 41 years old. She is married to Antoine and has four children, some of whom attend school.

In order to keep up with her family’s expenses with her husband, who is a storekeeper, Sèssimè has been stocking up on corn and local beverages in a city market to resell from her home for the last three years.

Although she didn’t go to school, she is known for managing her business well.

loans.use: to buy corn and local drinks

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad de clima cálido, paisajes turísticos hermosos, asimismo tiene una gastronomía variada y deliciosa. Es madre de 2 hijos de 16 y 19 años, a  quienes quiere muchísimo y por quienes daría la vida para poder  darles felicidad, y sobre todo poder ofrecerles una vida digna. Maria es muy carismática y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, por ello cada día Maria trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de jugos y sándwich, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes al día; Maria cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene buena sazon.

Maria esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá 2 licuadoras, mesa, sillas, entre otros, con lo cual podrá mejorar su negocio y poder atender de manera más pronta a los clientes, así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
María, 41, lives in the city of Pisco, a city with a hot climate, beautiful tourist sites and a varied, delicious cuisine.  She’ the mother of two children who are 16 and 19 who she loves very much and for whom she’d give her life to make  them happy and above all to give them a proper life. 

María is very charismatic and above all very much wants to get ahead which is why María works every day in a small business selling juices and sandwiches.  She works about 9 hours daily and can see up to 30 customers per day.  She believes she’s doing well because she’s nice to her customers and above all because she’s a very tasty cook.

María is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will be able to buy two blenders, a table and chairs, among others that will improve her business because she’ll be able to take care of customers more quickly thus improving her income and continuing to strive to make her greatest dream reality: to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy blenders, chairs and tables, among others.

loans.name: Kendric

texts.en:
Although Kendric did not have much experience in the food industry, he didn’t allow that fact to hinder him from opening his mobile restaurant, Empty Bowl. Beginning in Katy, Texas, Kendric started his mobile pasta dish business less than six months ago with very little resources and serves surrounding cities.  

To purchase necessary cooking equipment for his business, begin constructing his website and social media page, pay for advertising in print and online publications in Katy, cover vendor licensing fees at trade shows and food inventory, Kendric knew he would need financial assistance.

While researching business support websites, Kendric came across Accion Texas Inc.  He inquired with Accion regarding a small business loan.  Once Kendric followed through the loan application process he was approved for $5,450.

Kendric is now able to continue displaying his dishes at local trade shows and conventions around the Katy and Houston, Texas area. He plans to continue demonstrating his dishes at local events and build clientele to serve his pasta and spice up his business.

loans.use: To purchase cooking equipment, begin constructing his website and social media page, and to pay for advertising, vendor licensing fees, and food inventory.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria, de 45 años de edad , vive en la ciudad de León , tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad que está estudiando la primaria  ella es cosmetóloga y al mismo tiempo es dueña de un Cyber Café.  Negocio que tiene 1 año de estar funcionando pues ella observo que en su vecindario había la necesidad de instalar este tipo de actividad. Actualmente tiene 7 computadoras con las que brinda el servicio  de internet, es muy visitado por jóvenes universitarios y gente que vive alrededor, además como otras formas de conseguir ingresos  vende cosméticos en su casa. 
Ella está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar una fotocopiadora y un router. Esto le permitirá brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela. Uno de sus planes futuros es establecer dos Cyber Café adicionales para atender a más personas y llevarles el servicio.
texts.en:
María, 45, lives in the city of León.  She has a ten-year-old son attending primary school.  She’s a cosmetologist but at the same time owns an Internet Café.  This business has been in operation for a year since she noticed that her neighborhood needed this type of activity.  She currently has seven computers to provide Internet access service.  The business is quite frequented by young university students and by people who live nearby.  Also, as another way of earning income she sells cosmetics at home.

She’s asking for financing to buy a photocopier and a router which will make it possible for her to provide better customer service.  One of her future plans is to open two more Internet Cafés to tend to more people and provide them with this service.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier and a router.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 31-year-old diligent and hardworking woman. Her husband is a carpenter and she is helping her husband to meet the household expenses by selling dry fruits. She has been doing this business for 12 years. She has four children and three of them are currently studying in schools.

Fatima has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a large quantity of dry fruits from village at a cheaper rate to sell for profit. She would also package her dry fruits properly, through which her sales would be increased. Fatima is very hopeful that the loan will have a positive impact on her life.

loans.use: to purchase dry fruit

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman, and has been in the farming business for more than ten years. This is the source of her income.

Zenaida is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. 

In the future, Zenaida hopes to make her business a success, and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en: Wycliffe is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as polite and courageous. He has taken a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a water tank that will benefit four members of his family. They will be able to store clean water for use. He operates a bicycle transportation business whereby he carries customers from one place to another to earn an income. He hopes that in the future he will be able to build a permanent house. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 38-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and three sons. 

Her husband and all her sons are running a car decoration and accessories shop. This is the only source of income for her family. Currently they are facing many problems in business, as the current stock of car accessories is almost gone, and they have no funds to purchase more stock. 

Tasleem has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can continue his business and purchase a new variety of car accessories and decoration kits with items like car chargers, fog lights, seat covers, neon lights, etc. 

She is going to make arrangements for the marriage of her son, and for the expansion of their business, with the profit.

She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them, and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: To purchase car accessories for the family business.

loans.name: Pudak Sari Wangi Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh and all members of Pudak Sari Wangi are very grateful to MUK for having given them a new loan. Ni Luh is a housewife who is married with I Komang, and has 2 children. The older one is already married, but the other one is still in high school Class 2. Ni Luh been running the pigs business since she got married.

As a group leader of Pudak Sari Wangi, Ni Luh with 4 other members received a total of 7.5M Rupiahs (IDR) (each member of the group received 1.5M IDR) to develop pig farming. With funds provided her, Ni Luh will purchase 2 superior piglets and pig feed. Ni Luh hopes cooperation between the group and MUK will run continuously until they could have their own capital for breeding pigs.

loans.use: to purchase 2 superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante varios años y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea hacer la siembra que es el que muestra la fotografia ya que donde el reside los terrenos son muy pedregosos y muy rústicos,  Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que él consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Salvador, 45, lives with his family in his own house.  He works in agriculture growing corn and beans.  He’s been in this occupation for several years and this is how he earns his daily bread.  He’s a hardworking, responsible man who is very well-known in the zone because of his big heart and his kindness towards others.

Because planting season has arrived he wants to invest in seeds, manure, insecticide, etc. and to improve the land where he wants to plant which is shown in the photo because it’s very rocky and rustic.  What he most wants is that his crop yield will be abundant and better than past ones because this is how he acquires his family’s sustenance.  He trusts in God that with your help, his dedication and effort at work he’ll reach his dream of improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Prudencia's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de trois personnes réunit des voisines de quartiers qui ont décidé de se réunir pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

La représentante du groupe, Prudencia (celle qui a la main levée au milieu de la photo)est âgée de 38 ans, mariée, et a eu 2 enfants avec son mari Maxime, qui est cuisinier.
Leurs enfants sont scolarisés et vivent avec eux.
Pour aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes, Prudencia va s'approvisionner en tissus dans un marché de sa localité depuis maintenant 6 ans pour les revendre à son domicile.

Elle contracte aujourd'hui ce crédit dans le but de développer son activité.
texts.en:
This group comprises three women from the same neighborhood who have decided to come together to request their first loan from ALIDé.

Prudencia, the group's representative, is 38 years old.  She is married, and she has had two children with her husband, Maxime, who works as a cook.  In the photo, Prudencia is the woman raising her hand in the middle of the group.

Prudencia's children are in school and live with their parents.

In order to help her husband to take care of the day-to-day expenses, Prudencia has been buying fabrics at a local market for the past six years.  She then resells her merchandise from home.

She is now taking this loan in order to develop her activity.

loans.use: to buy some "pagnes" (colorful West African fabrics) and resell them from home.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Beginning in New York as a part-time job, Lawrence brought his chauffer business to Austin, Texas.

Offering personalized service, Lawrence visits business personnel, such as hotel managers, to market himself. From there, he is able to take clients to and from airports, hotels and shopping centers in and around Austin. 

Boulevard Chauffeur has been in business for four years. “I enjoy driving,” he says. “Every day is different.” The entrepreneur gene is in Lawrence’s blood, he says. “I enjoy being self-employed.”

Lawrence also says being a chauffeur is a profitable business. As Lawrence is the only employee of his business, he plans to hire one more employee soon. However, before he can hire anyone, he needs to expand his business.

To purchase a second vehicle, Lawrence went to Compass Bank for a loan, but was then referred to Accion Texas Inc. The 46-year-old father of three says the loan helped to take advantage of the opportunity to expand, without which, he would have had to pass.

loans.use: to purchase a second vehicle.

loans.name: Sandy Rosalia

texts.es:
Sandy es un joven de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad de clima cálido, paisajes turísticos hermosos, asimismo tiene una gastronomía variada y deliciosa. Sandy es una joven madre de una pequeña de 2 años y junto a su pareja trabajan cada día para poder brindarle una vida digna y sobre todo poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro. Sandy debido a los pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Sandy trabaja vendiendo comida  y bebidas gaseosas afuera de su vivienda, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes diariamente; Sandy cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo tiene buena sazón.

Sandy está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un toldo para poder colocarlo afuera de su vivienda y con ello brindarle mayor comodidad a sus clientes, asimismo comprara mesas, sillas y una congeladora, de esta manera podrá atender a sus clientes con mayor comodidad y poder mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Sandy is a 23-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pisco. Pisco has a very warm climate, and beautiful, touristic landscapes as well as a variety of delicious foods. Sandy is the young mother of a 2-year-old daughter and together with her husband, she works every day to be able to provide her with a dignified life and a better future.

Due to a lack of economic resources, Sandy was only able to study through her senior year in high school, though she would have like to continue studying at a university. Each day, Sandy works selling food and soft drinks from her home. She works about nine hours a day and serves up to 30 customers daily. Sandy believes that she is getting ahead because she is very kind to her customers and, above all, she is a very good cook.

Sandy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she has been able to buy an awning to put outside of her home and thus, offer her customers a more comfortable atmosphere. She will purchase tables, chairs, and a freezer. In this way, she will be able to better attend to her customers and increase her profits. Sandy will continue trying to turn her dream into a reality: "to own her own house and have a big restaurant."

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, an awning, a freezer, and other items.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a Kiva borrower, age 47 years. She describes herself as social. She is married and has five children with ages between 7 and 13 years. She has taken a loan of KES 21,000 to buy a water tank that she will use to store water that will be sold to customers. They face the challenge of a lack of water in the community.

Peris keeps livestock and also works at farming to earn an income. She hopes that in future she will be able to educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store and sell water.

loans.name: Rubidia

texts.es:
Rubidia, vive con su esposo de 50 años de edad y con su suegra de 82 años de edad, disfruta de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 7 y 10 años, todos dependen del negocio. Ella posee una sastrería, el oficio lo realiza desde hace varios años atrás y elabora uniformes para niños de la escuela, lo desempeña todos los días.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar materia prima para llevar a cabo su trabajo, entre estos están: tela, botones, zippers, agujas, cono de hilos, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a obtener más clientela y elaborar uniformes de calidad.
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rubidia lives with her 50-year-old husband and her 82-year-old mother-in-law.  She enjoys her two children who are 7 and 10 years of age; all depend on her business.  She has a tailor shop, an occupation she’s been in for several years now; she manufactures uniforms for school children every day.

The loan she needs will make it possible for her to buy raw materials like fabric, buttons, zippers, needles, thread cones, etc. to carry out her work.  This investment will help her acquire more customers and to make quality uniforms.  Her dream is to provide her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John began his start-up business, Pro 1 Stop less than six months ago.  The mechanic is trained to diagnose and service many vehicles from minor to major issues.  Before opening up his own business, John worked for other mechanic shops around the Little Rock area.  

One day, a friend, an Accion Texas Inc. employee referred John to Accion to inquire about applying for a small business loan.  John proceeded to submit his application and was approved for $5,450. The Accion loan allowed John to purchase new tools to service vehicles and reach his goal of opening up his own business.  John says: “Without the loan, it would have taken longer to reach my goal.”  Some of Pro 1’s services include oil changes, tune-ups and regular maintenance for most vehicles. 

The updated equipment and tools allowed John to service vehicles more efficiently and build a clientele to jump start his business.  He is the sole employee of the company and does not have plans to hire additional help at the moment, but plans to expand in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new tools.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Гулнора женщина среднего возраста. Родилась и выросла в городе Исфаре. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Занимается продажей женской одежды, на местном рынке. После окончания школы, она поступила в местный педагогический колледж,и сразу после окончания начала работать в детском саду своего города. Тогда ее дети были маленькие и заработной платы хватало, но теперь ее дети выросли и расходов стало больше. Гулнора решила заняться своим бизнесом. Она стала торговать женской одеждой. Сначала она была продавщицей постепенно когда научилась,стала сама привозить товар. С 2010 года Гулнора сотрудничает с организацией Арванд. Благодаря Арванду она самостоятельно открыла точку и намного расширила свой бизнес.
 На данный момент Гулнора планирует закупить новый ассортимент товара женской одежды и снова с надеждой обратилась в Арванд. Гулнора очень признательна этой организации и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Gulnora is a middle-aged woman. She born and raised in the city of Isfara in Tajikistan. She's married, has two children, and makes a living by selling women's clothing on the local market. 

After finishing school, Gulnora attended a local college studying to become a teacher. Upon graduation, she started working in a local kindergarten. During that time, her children were small, and Gulnora's income was sufficient to support them. However, her children have grown now and, therefore, so have the expenses. Gulnora decided to supplement her income by becoming a saleswoman and selling women's clothing on the market. She gradually learned the nuances of the trade and then started importing the products herself. 

Gulnora has worked with Arvand since 2010. Thanks to the latter's assistance, she was able to open and later expand her own salespoint. Currently, Gulnora is planning to purchase an assortment of products and has turned to Arvand for help. She's very grateful and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 34-year-old, hard-working housewife with four sons and three daughters; she is a resident of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For the past five years, her husband has been driving a van which is the only source of income for his family. 

Shazia  has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her husband's transportation business by buying a new van. They are saving money for this purpose, and with the addition of the loan, they would be able to buy this van.This will not only help expand their transportation business, but will also help increase their monthly income. 

She is very hopeful that the loan will be productive so that they can meet the basic necessities of their family, and provide an education for their children.

loans.use: To purchase a van for her husband's transportation business.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 29-year-old responsible housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, two daughters, and two sons. 

Her husband works in a wood shop; he has a very low salary. It is very difficult for them to manage the household expenses; they are facing many problems in life. 

Since 2010, Shumaila has been running a small general store to generate a second source of income for her family. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She wants to buy a variety of goods like milk, sugar, rice, soap, detergents, creams, etc and introduce some new items in her general store to fulfill the demands of her customers.  She also wants to increase her savings. 

She would reinvest the profit in the general store, use a part of it to pay her household expenses, and use part on the education of her children. 

She is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan for their support. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her.

loans.use: To purchase items for her general store.

loans.name: Juan De Jesus

texts.es: Juan de 48 años de edad,  desde hace varios años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y frijol, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus seis hijos.  Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, que es su principal fuente de ingresos, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente.  Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar crédito ya que la temporada para la siembra comenzó y es necesario iniciar la siembra lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita el crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes, herbicidas,  etc. para la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá acceder a una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 48, has worked cultivating the land for many years.  With much dedication he grows corn and beans that allows him to provide daily bread at home.  He’s noted for being a hardworking, honest and responsible man.  He lives with his family group consisting of his wife and six children.  He and his wife work hard to move their family forward and to provide them with better conditions than they have had.  Thanks to his agricultural knowledge he’s able to provide sustenance for his home for it’s his main source of income and the only way he knows of earning an honest livelihood.

With a strong desire for self-improvement, he approached this institution to request a loan since the planting season has started and it’s necessary to start planting as soon as possible.  This is the reason why he’s asking for a loan because he needs to buy agricultural supplies like seeds, manure, insecticide, fertilizer, herbicide, etc. for the crops.  He trusts in God and in his work; that in this way he will obtain an abundant harvest that will allow him to access better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Françoise's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de trois femmes est composées de voisines de quartier qui sollicitent aujourd'hui leur premier crédit auprès d'ALIDé.

La représentante du groupe, Françoise (la main levée au milieu de la photo) est âgée de 51 ans. 
Françoise est mariée et à deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et à leurs charges. 

Françoise n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais elle a appris la couture qu'elle exerce depuis près de 10 ans.
Elle demande aujourd'hui un prêt afin de développer son activité de couture à domicile. Pour ce faire, elle ira s'approvisionner au marché de sa localité afin d'acheter des tissus.

En parallèle, elle développe une activité de vente de pagnes et de boissons pour répondre à la demande de sa clientèle de quartier.
texts.en:
This group consists of three women who are neighbors. They are seeking their first loan from ALIDé.

Françoise, age 51, is the group’s representative. She is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is the married mother of two dependent children who go to school. Françoise never attended school, but she learned to sew, and she has been practicing this activity for nearly 10 years.

She is seeking a loan to help her expand the sewing shop she runs from her home. She will use the funds to stock up on supplies at the local market, where she will buy fabrics.

As a secondary activity, she also sells pagnes and beverages to the locals.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her sewing activity.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia y aun no tiene hijos,  es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
This client lives with her life companion in her own house; they don’t have children yet.  She’s very well-known in the zone where she lives because of her humility and dedication to work.  She’s never let herself be defeated and has always overcome her difficulties.  

With effort and dedication she has a store where she sells basic staples like basic grains, milk, eggs and rice, among others.   She’s very dedicated to her work and very service oriented when sells which is why she has many customers that seek her out and prefer her for her products.  

She needs to stock the store a little better because of increased demand but does not have capital to do so which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy more products like basic grains, instant products, snacks, beverages, etc.  She trusts in God that the requested help will be granted soon so she won’t have any more worries about providing daily sustenance for her home.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as focused and determined. She has taken a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a water tank in order to store clean water. Five members of her family will benefit directly from the tank. She operates a wholesale trade shop to earn an income. She faces a challenge of competition from other wholesalers in this business. She hopes that in the future she will attain economic growth. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en: Andresa is a vegetable and fruit vendor from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has had a retail business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a carpenter. Andresa is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her stock as well as her income. In the future, Andresa dreams of expanding her store and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as focused and optimistic. She sells milk to earn an income, and she faces a challenge of competition from other sellers in this business.

She has taken a loan of Kes 20,000 to buy a water dispenser that will benefit seven members of her family. They will be able to access clean, safe drinking water.

Sarah hopes that in the future she will obtain financial freedom. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM; her previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water dispenser for her family.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 32-year-old hardworking, diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, a daughter, and a son. 

Her husband is a government employee, but his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. Both of her children are studying in government schools. 

Asia is an efficient beautician by profession. Since 2010, she has been operating her own beauty salon. Currently, the beauty stock of the salon is almost gone, so Asia wants to purchase cosmetic products to continue her business. She has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase beauty products like facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, makeup kits, hair colors, and other products. She would also buy some new chairs for her salon. 

She will pay the installments on the loan, and school fees for her children with the profits. She dreams of living a happy, healthy, and peaceful life with her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To purchase products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 38-year-old woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, six sons and two daughters. Her husband is a Diabetic patient and she always worries about his health. For 11 years her husband has been running a wood shop, which is the only source of income for their family. All of her sons are very hardworking and help their father in his business a lot.

Uzma  has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband in his business. Her husband would purchase a wood cutting machine and some wood material for his shop. As they have no other source of income, her husband will be able to continue his business with the help of this loan, and with the net profit he will open a new shop for his son. Uzma dreams for her children's bright future and prays for her husband's good health. She wants to say that BRAC is working very well in the field of micro-finance, and she is very thankful to BRAC and Kiva for helping her.

loans.use: To purchase a wood cutting machine.

loans.name: Mazrom

texts.en: Mazrom is a 54-year-old hardworking housewife. Her husband has been running a snooker club for 12 years. This club is located in the main market of the city and has been running very successfully. Due to the increasing number of customers, her husband wants to purchase one more snooker table. Mazrom has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a snooker table for her husband's business in order to help him expand the business. This will help them to increase their monthly income and their savings. Mazrom will save the profit for the marriage of her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase a snooker table

loans.name: Nosheen

texts.en: Nosheen is a 28-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. Her husband is working as a spray painter in an auto mechanic workshop. Nosheen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan her husband would buy some new spray paints and spray materials like a spray machine and chemicals, etc. His current stock is almost gone, and with the help of this loan Nosheen's husband can continue his work. This is the only source of income for their family so this loan is very important for them. Nosheen is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a spray machine and chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol and the mother of two children. She has been engaged in the farming business for more than six years now. This is the source of her income. Marlyn is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. Marlyn dreams of expanding her farm so that it will generate more income, which is necessary for the needs of the family, such as food and educational expenses for the children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Taj

texts.en: A loan of 20,000 PKR would help Taj to get a new sewing machine for her daughter so that she can help her in her work. Taj has been doing this tailoring work for 15 years and she has excellent tailoring skills. Now, with the help of her daughter, she will be able to stitch more dresses, resulting in an increase in her monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa de un familiar con su esposa y su hija de 1 año de edad,  Él se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace algunos años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes, etc.  Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
This client lives in a relative’s house with his wife and one-year-old daughter.  He has worked growing corn and beans for some years now.  He earns his livelihood this way and is able to provide daily bread for his home.  He does this activity year to year since it’s the only way he knows of earning his livelihood.  He’s a very hardworking, honest, responsible man. 

 Despite the conditions he lives in which are very humble he does not tire of working and giving his family the best.  He’s decided to request a loan to buy the main agricultural supplies: manure, pest poison, seeds, fertilizer, etc.   

He hopes to obtain favorable results because he has no other source of income.  He trusts in God that he’ll obtain an abundant harvest that will make it possible for him to continue providing daily bread for his home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anyar Sari 1 Group

texts.en:
The success of a group of pigs can be seen if some members don't have to borrow again and continue the business with their own capital. Like in the Anyar Sari 1 group--two members resigned from membership of the group because they have managed to develop their pigs business and have enough capital to continue this effort.

Ni Wayan will use the loan to buy four super quality piglets for fattening. The sow gives birth every four months and Ni Wayan hopes in the fifth and sixth months she could sell her pigs. She hopes she can be independent and continue the business with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy four super quality piglets

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria runs a variety store in San Miguel, Bohol. She sells various goods to the people in her neighborhood. For more than 17 years, Maria and her husband have also been engaged in a farming business. Maria is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell in her store like canned goods, candies, and noodles, as well as fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this, she will be able to improve her ventures and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, candies, and noodles, as well as fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Marilyn has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Marilyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 55 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Gilda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Gilda has been farming rice for 11 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business farming rice and raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Erlina works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming and selling vegetables. 

Erlina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase items such us sugar, milk, soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Erlina has sustained her business activities with her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such us sugar, milk, soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ruom

texts.en: Ruom, in her early 50s, is a resident from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province where rice farming is the popular business in the area. She has five children, two of whom are students in the local school. Her main source of income is from three hectares each of rainy season and dry season paddy crop. The 20 years' engagement in her current business has returned her about 32,000 KHR per day. Never before a member of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Ruom is taking her first loan of 3,000,000 KHR in order to pay for plowing fees and to buy potash and rice seed. She hopes that she can grow her crops fruitfully and make a good yield to relieve her family’s financial burden.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees and to buy potash and rice seed

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 35-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and daughter in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her biggest dream in life is to marry her daughter into a good and respectable family. For eight years, Shehnaz's husband has been driving a taxi, which is the only source of income for his family. But for the last 20 days he has not been able to generate any income, as his taxi stopped working and needs to be repaired. Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to repair her husband's taxi so that he can continue his work. This will not only improve the taxi's condition, but will help in improving the family's income as well.

loans.use: To repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is very happy with her Kiva loan because she is now able to buy materials to make her artisan crafts. She sold her craft work, satisfying her customers' needs. Now Shakeela is dedicating all her attention to her son and business because she is no longer working for another business. She is happy about this because she is able to give other unemployed people the opportunity to earn an income. 

Shakeela sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "Thank you for the loan. It has benefited my family and me greatly." Shakeela is currently applying for a Kiva loan that she will use to buy artisan materials like stones, quartz, glass, beads, needles, lace, clothes wire, small pieces of wood, glue, and paint.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery materials

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 36 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is a mother of five children and she is a responsible and hardworking housewife. Her husband owns a furniture shop in the market. This shop is the base of earning for the family. He works very hard to meet the household's expenses, but due to an insufficient income he is facing problems meeting the needs of his family. 

Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband will purchase a variety of furniture to sell. By doing so, he will increase his net income and savings for the future. Shazia is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She wants to purchase a computer for her children with the profits. Shazia wishes to provide computer education to her children in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase furniture to sell.

loans.name: Elmaddin

texts.en:
Elmaddin is 31 years old, married, and has a son. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. Now Elmaddin lives in the Fizuli region with his family. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income. His son goes to school and he is 15 years old. Elmaddin wants his son to become a sportsman. 

Elmaddin started his business five years ago to grow and resell calves. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more calves. He wants to use the money for the future of his child. In the future, Elmaddin wants to have a big farm for sheep and calves. This will be more profitable for his business. Elmaddin is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad de clima variado y en el cual se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de maíz, manzana, entre otros. Elizabeth es madre de una pequeña de 2 años de edad, al cual quiere muchísimo y cada día se esfuerza para poder sacarla adelante.  Elizabeth es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa de niños, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo; Elizabeth cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y siempre ofrece productos de buena calidad a precios bajos.

Elizabeth esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas ropa para niños pero de estación de invierno, como chompitas, casacas, pantalones, buzos, entre otros; así ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y poder tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y poder tener un local propio para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 22, lives in the city of Imperial, a city of varied climate where agriculture abounds especially growing corn and apples, among others.  Elizabeth is the mother of a little two-year old girl who she loves very much and for whom she strives daily to be able to move her forward.  Elizabeth is a young woman who very much wants to get ahead.  This is why after much effort and saving she managed to start her own business selling children’s clothes.  She works about 9 hours daily because she’s able with much effort to cover some of her household expenses with the fruits of her labor.  Elizabeth believes that she’s getting ahead because she’s very gracious to customers and always offers good quality products at low price.

Elizabeth is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy children’s winter clothes like little sweaters, jackets, pants and sweatshirts, among others.  She will thus be able to improve her income and have a wider selection of products on hand to offer her customers and she will be able to continue striving to reach her greatest dream: to provide her child with a profession and in future to have a space of her own for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 50 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Julieta has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Julieta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Nisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nisa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Nisa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell in her business.

Nisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Margarita has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is 32 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Neneth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy sugar, soap, shampoo, and other groceries to sell.

Neneth has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Neneth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, shampoo, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Liaqat

texts.en:
Liaqat is a 38-year-old hard \-working and independent woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has no children and is currently living with her husband in a rented house. Her husband is jobless and she is the only income-earning person in the family. Liaqat works in a dental clinic but she wants to start her own pharmacy. 

Liaqat has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to open a new medical store and to purchase a variety of medicines for that store. She hopes and prays that her husband gets a job soon. She is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To open a pharmacy

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is 32 years old and married, with three children. With two children currently in school, Edlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Edlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional goods, like shampoo, coffee, sugar, bath soap, and cooking oil, to sell in her general store.

Edlyn has been in this business for eight years and she sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, coffee, sugar, bath soap, and cooking oil. 

In the future, Edlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods, like shampoo, coffee, sugar, bath soap, and cooking oil, to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Magaly Janeth

texts.es:
Magaly tiene 24 años de edad, y es madre de un pequeño de 5 años de edad, el cual es su adoración y su motor para poder seguir esforzándose cada día por salir adelante y sobre todo ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades de las que ella tuvo, ya que debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el 2 grado de educación secundaria.

Luego de ahorrar y sobre todo de mucho esfuerzo Magaly logro indicar su negocio de venta de frutas, principalmente el plátano, así con el fruto de sus humilde trabajo puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo los gastos de su hogar, Magaly trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el dia, Magaly cree que está saliendo adelante porque se esfuerza mucho y sobre todo porque es muy responsable.

Magaly esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al gran apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio especialmente plátano y papaya al por mayor, de esta manera tendrá mayor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirás seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una carrera universitaria a su hijo y poder tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Magaly, 24, is the mother of a little five-year-old who is her adoration and motivation to continue striving to get ahead and above all to offer him better quality of life and better opportunities than she had because due to her limited economic resources she was only able to complete second grade of secondary school.

After saving and above all with much effort, Magaly was able to start her business selling fruit, mainly bananas, so that with the fruits of her humble labor she’s able with much effort to cover her household expenses.  Magaly works around 9 hours daily and can see up to 20 customers per day.  Magaly believes she’s getting ahead because she tries very hard and above all because she’s very responsible.

Magaly is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the great support they have given her she will be able to buy more merchandise especially bananas and papayas at wholesale in order to have greater variety of products and to improve her income which will allow her to continue striving to make her greatest dream reality: to provide university career for her son and to own a minimarket.

loans.use: to buy fruit like bananas at wholesale.

loans.name: Olguita

texts.es:
Olguita tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de un hijo de 6 años de edad, el cual es muy travieso y a quien Olguita quiere muchísimo, sobre todo porque se ha convertido en el regalo mas importante que Dios le ha dado y por el cual es capaz de dar la vida para poder hacerlo feliz.
 
Olguita cada día se levanta muy temprano para trabajar, ella se dedica a  brindar servicio de costura y confección de prendas, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con los ingresos de su negocio solventa los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo; Olguita cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y siempre ofrece un buen servicio.

Olguita esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han  brindado ella podrá comprar una máquina de coser ya que su máquina actual está en malas condicione sy puede realizar su trabajo a tiempo, de esta manera podrá atender a sus clientes con mayor prontitud y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un taller de costura y poder brindarle una carrera universitaria a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Olguita, 28, is the mother of a six-year-old son who is very mischievous and who Olguita loves very much above all because he’s become the most important gift God has given her and for whom she’s capable of giving her life to make him happy.  Olguita rises very early to start work.  She provides sewing services and makes clothes.  She works about 9 hours daily and is able to cover her household expenses with the income she earns with much effort.  Olguita believes she’s getting ahead because she’s very kind to customers and always provides good service.

Olguita is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will be able to buy a sewing machine since her current machine is in bad shape and she will be able to do her work on time and take care of more customers more quickly which will lead to improved income so she can continue to strive to make her greatest dream reality: to have a sewing workshop and to provide her son with a university career.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Zalvie

texts.en: Zalvie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for 5 years. She earns more income from her general store. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her fish vending business. Zalvie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 57 years old, married, and has two children. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 33 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, a 36-year-old mother of one, is a crop grower from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham. Her one hectare growing a rice crop and half hectare growing cassava are the main income source of her family, to tackle their financial burden. During her spare time, she works for others for a fee for extra income. Phally is in her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and has repaid her past loan with success. It has enabled her to relieve the difficulty in her family at a good pace. Now, she is seeking a new loan in order to buy fertilizer for her farmland and grow more cassava. She believes that she can make more income from her crop husbandry to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and grow more cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nimfa works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending and raising pigs. Nimfa is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soap, chips, shampoo, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Nimfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soap, chips, shampoo, etc., to sell

loans.name: Dulcesima

texts.en: Dulcesima works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines, which she has had for 47 years now. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business. In the future, Dulcesima would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: A mother of six children from Kampong Cham province, Thy is 46 years old and one of the breadwinners in the family. Her two hectares of rice farming and one and a half hectares of cassava cropping, the business which she has had for 20 years, earns her about 23,500 KHR per day to overcome the need in her family. Thy, who has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, is seeking the first loan of 2,000,0000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that her cassava will grow fruitfully so she can make more profits to buy additional farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa de un familiar con sus hijos y su compañero de vida quien le ayuda en el negocio, desde hace 3 años tomo la decisión de poner un puesto de venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros, carteras, peluches, etc. en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene  mucha clientela fija que la busca por sus buenos productos y a precios muy accesibles, también por su buena amabilidad a la hora de vender, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos en su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería por mayor y poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The client lives in a family member’s house with her children and her life partner, who helps her with the business.  Three years ago she made the decision to set up a stand selling men’s and women’s underwear, purses, and stuffed animals, etc.  She sells at the market that is close to where she lives.  It has gone very well for her because she has a lot of fixed clientele who seek her out for her good products, affordable prices, and her kind way of making a sale.  With the earnings that she gets, she manages to pay some of her household expenses.

The client is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy more merchandise wholesale.  She will also use the loan to be able to continue with her business because it is her only source of work.  This way she will be able to give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fishing nets, as well as hooks and other tools.

loans.name: Carlos Froilan

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 25 años de edad, vive en la calida ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad de clima muy cálido, gastronomía variada y sobre todo sus pobladores son personas muy alegres y carismáticas.  Carlos es padre de un pequeño de 3 años de edad al cual quiere muchísimo y por quien daría la vida para poder darle una vida digna y sobre todo verlo feliz.

A pesar de sus pocos recursos económicos Carlos logro estudiar la carrera de Técnico en contabilidad y gracias a ello logro tener empleo en una pequeña institución de su ciudad, con el fruto de su trabajo solventa los gastos del hogar; el cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene la mayor inspiración para salir adelante, la cual es su hijo.

Carlos esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda ya que es de adobe y calima, asi podra mejorar la calida de vida de su hijo y seguir luchando y esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Carlos, 25, lives in the city of Pucallpa, a city with very hot climate and varied cuisine; above all its residents are very cheerful, charismatic people.  Carlos is the father of a little 3-year-old who he loves dearly and for whom he’d give his life to provide a good life for him and above all to make him happy.

Despite his limited economic resources, Carlos managed to study a technical Accounting career and thanks to that he managed to get a job in a small institution in his city.  With the fruit of his labor he’s able to cover household expenses.  He believes he’s getting ahead because he’s very responsible and above all because he has a great inspiration to get ahead: his son.

Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given him he will be able to do some home improvements since his house is made of adobe and chalk and he will be able to improve his son’s quality of life and continue to strive to make his greatest dream reality: to have a house of his own.

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Youkou 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Youkou 2 fait partie de la coopérative Coopagui et est située à Guiroutou, un petit village au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de 14 personnes. 
Cédric a 24 ans et est un jeune producteur de cacao. Cela fait 2 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative Coopagui et il a 3 hectares de cacao certifiés UTZ et Rain Forest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter des produits phytosanitaires pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il va se faire construire une maison.
texts.en:
The group Youkou 2 is part of the Coopagui cooperative. It is located in Guiroutou, a small village in the southwest of Ivory Coast, in the region of San Pedro. The group has 14 members.

Cédric, age 24, is a young cacao farmer. He has been with Coopagui for two years, and his three hectares of cacao farmland are certified by UTZ and by the Rainforest Alliance, which means that he adheres to the principles and regulations of sustainable agriculture.

He plans to use this loan to buy pesticides for his cacao plantation. This will allow him to increase production and to bolster his income. 

He wants to use the additional revenue to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for his cacao plantation.

loans.name: Heam's Group

texts.en:
Heam, a mother of two schoolchildren, is 39 years old and a farmer. She and the rest of her family live in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, where cassava is the popular cash-crop in the area. Similar to her neighbor, she also grows cassava and rice for additional income. She earns about 22,000 KHR per day

Heam has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for 17 years. In a group of two, Heam is the leader and a second-cycle borrower, while her joint member is a third-time borrower. They are seeking the same loan amount from VisionFund, 1,2000,000 KHR each.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed. 

She hopes that she can grow her crops in a timely manner, and gain a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kongossigue Dit Yacouba

texts.fr:
Natif du cercle de Bla, Région de Ségou, Monsieur Kongossigue est âgé de 37 ans et père de 4 enfants. Il vit dans une famille polygame avec ses 2 femmes et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni. 
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, il ne faisait que l’agriculture auprès de son père au village. Quelques années plus tard il décida  de quitter le village pour Bougouni afin d’apprendre le commerce notamment la vente des articles divers  de boutique, auprès de son oncle.  Avec 4 années d’expérience, il maitrise bien cette activité. Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un agent de l’institution, il décida d’intégrer le programme crédit avec qui il est à son quatrième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursés les trois précédents.
Il compte acheter avec ce nouveau prêt, 5 sacs du sucre, 10 cartons de thé, 8 cartons de cigarettes et 9 cartons de savons. Sa boutique est située à Niebala un des quartiers de Bougouni. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako capitale de la république du Mali et parfois à Bougouni. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale. Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Kongossigue compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêts, assurer les dépenses de sa famille et à agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
A native of Cercle de Bla, Région de Ségou, Mr.  Kongossigue is 37 years old and a father of four. He lives in a polygamous family with his two wives and his children in the Hérémakono Nord district of Bougouni. Not having attended school, he used to be a farmer with his father in the village. A few years later, he decided to leave the village for Bougouni to learn about commerce from his uncle, especially about selling various shop goods, With four years of experience, he has a mastery of this business. 

Familiar with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso through one of its representatives, he decided to join the loan program and is now on his fourth loan. He has correctly repaid the three previous ones.

With this new loan, he intends to purchase 5 sacks of sugar, 10 boxes of tea, 8 boxes of cigarettes, and 9 boxes of soap. His store is located in Niebala, a district in Bougouni. He gets his supplies from Bamako, capital of the Republic of Mali. His customer base is composed of the local people. 

With this loan, Mr. Kongossigue plans on making a monthly profit of 85,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay the loan interest, to ensure his family expenses are covered, and to expand his store.

loans.use: to purchase various goods, such as sugar, cigarettes, and tea, for his store

loans.name: Srin's Group

texts.en:
Age 30 and a mother of one little kid, Srin is also an inhabitant from Kampong Cham province. She does rice farming on a one hectare area with the support from her husband. She is able to earn up to 31,200 KHR per day from the business that she has managed for 10 years. 

This is the first loan for Srin with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). It is also the same cycle of the other three borrowers in the same group. The total amount of her entire group loan is 4,000,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is Srin’s loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her loan to buy fragrant rice seed and potash for her farmland. She hopes that she can increase her income and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fragrant rice seed and potash for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service his mototaxi and install doors on it.

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Pha is in her late 30s, and the widowed mother of three kids who are working for others for a fee. She lives in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, where she does rice cropping. Her ten years of experience in her current business has earned her about 11,000 KHR per day. 

With this new loan, Pha will be a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three members;  the other two fellow group members are third-cycle clients. The past loans have supported her business well. 

The total amount of her new group loan is 2,700,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion of 1,400,000 KHR to pay a plowing fee. 

She hopes she can improve the living conditions of her family in a great place.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
A rice grower on two hectares of farmland from Kampong Cham province, Pov is 35 years old and married. She has three dependent children to take care of, two of whom are in school and the remaining one is too young for schooling. The current business has generated her about 33,900 KHR per day. 

Pov and other three members in the same group of four female members are seeking their first loan of 1,000,000 KHR each from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For Pov, who is the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm. She hopes that she can make more income to enlarge her business better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose tiene 25 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, el desarrollo de su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de la uva, esparrago, entre otros.  Debido a los pocos recursos económicos Jose solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Luego de mucho esfuerzo Jose logro inicar su negocio de instalación de puertas y ventanas de aluminio, trabajo con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su familia ya que el vive al lado de su esposa, quien lo apoya mucho en todo lo que el emprende y lo apoya en su negocio, Jose cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque es my cumplido con los clientes.

Jose esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podra realizar mejoramientos en su vivienda, especialmente podra colocar un cerco para poder dar mas seguridad a su vivienda ya que hace algunos mese fue victima de un robo, asi podra seguir trabajando con mayor tranquilidad, ya que su familia estará mas segura, y podra seguir luchando para poder ahcer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
José, 25, lives in the city of Ica which is noted for its hot, welcoming climate and for the development of agriculture especially growing grapes and asparagus, among others.  Because of his limited economic resources, José was only able to finish fifth grade of secondary school but he would have liked to have attended university.

After much effort José managed to start his own business installing aluminum doors and windows, work that makes it possible for him to cover his family expenses since he lives with his wife who supports everything he does and helps him with the business.  José believes he’s getting ahead because he’s very responsible and above all because he meets his customers’ expectations.

José is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to do some home improvements, especially to be able to install a fence to provide more security for his home since he was the victim of a burglary a few months ago. In this way he will be able to continue working with more tranquility because his family will be safer and he can continue striving to make his greatest dream reality: to own a house.

loans.use: to build a fence.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
