Mary requires a loan in order to buy more fishing-nets for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her level of living. In the future, Mary plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fishing-nets for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Sarah from Tombo, a coastal town in the Western Area Rural District of Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children, who are between the ages of 1 and 16 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. In 2010, Sarah established her home products business. She began her business, because she wants to strive for herself and her family. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is, sometimes people who owe her money don't pay.

Sarah requires a loan in order to buy knives, food containers, and plates to resell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, Sarah plans to begin importing her goods. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy knives, food containers, and plates to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some tea tree seedlings, onions and carrots.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Rugiatu, age 35, runs a general store where she sells such items as milk, biscuits, alcohol, and cigarettes. She lives with her husband and their two children, ages eight and 15, in Tombo, which is in a western rural area of Sierra Leone. Rugiatu started her business in 2008 because the income earned by her husband, a fisherman, was not enough to support the family. She tells us that the main obstacle to her enterprise is lack of capital to expand her business.

Rugiatu has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more items such as alcohol, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits to offer for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and allow her to pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. 

Rugiatu is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as milk, cigarettes, alcohol, and biscuits to offer for sale

loans.name: Álvaro Alonso

texts.es: El señor Álvaro Alonso es un hombre de 58 años de edad, casado y con dos hijos. Hace aproximadamente 38 años se dedica al oficio de la ebanistería, el cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a su esposa e hijos y brindarles una calidad de vida aceptable. El cliente desea invertir el crédito en el arreglo del techo de su negocio, ya que se le está filtrando el agua y para ello requiere tejas de eternit y alambre y, el resto del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de una máquina canteadora de madera con la cual podrá realizar un trabajo más pulido, en menor tiempo y de esta forma le brindará mayor calidad a sus clientes y, de esta manera aumentará sus niveles de producción y venta, lo que le permitirá  generar mayores ingresos para su familia. Su mayor sueño es poder brindar empleo a más personas y poder enseñar todo lo aprendido en sus años de experiencia.
texts.en:
Señor Álvaro Alonso is a 58-year-old man who is married with two children.  For approximately 38 years he has made a living through cabinet-making, which has allowed him to get his wife and children ahead in life and to provide them with an acceptable quality of life.  He wishes to invest the loan in repairing the roof of his business because it is leaking water and he needs Eternit-brand tiles and wire.  

The rest of the loan will be used to purchase a wood edging machine so that he can do more refined work in less time and in this way offer better quality to his customers, which will increase his production levels and sales.  This will allow him to generate a higher income for his family.  His greatest dream is to be able to offer employment to more people and to teach all that he has learned in his years of experience.

loans.use: to buy a wood edging machine and to improve his location (fix the roof of his business and to buy Eternit-brand tiles).

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu, age 25, runs a general store. She lives with her husband and their two children, ages four and seven, in Tombo, which is in a western rural area of Sierra Leone. Both children are currently enrolled in school. Mariatu was a housewife until she established her general store in 2010. She started her business in order to help support her children and to raise the family's standard of living.

Mariatu works at her business seven days per week and 15 hours per day. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation problems and price inflation.

Mariatu is requesting a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, soap, milk, toothpaste, and sardines to offer for sale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take good care of her family and she prays that she will deliver her baby safely. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to build a permanent residence for her family. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, soap, milk, toothpaste, and sardines to offer for sale

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny, age 33, is a farmer. She lives and works in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province with her husband and their two children. Both children live at home and are enrolled in school. Vanny and her husband support the family by managing three hectares of cassava farming and two hectares of soybean planting. She has been engaged in this business for 13 years.

This will be Vanny's first loan cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund. She is requesting a loan in order to plow her farmland, buy rice seed, and pay for labor costs. 

She strongly believes that this loan will allow her to increase her income, allowing her to offer better living conditions to her family. Her goal is to keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: to plow her farmland, buy rice seed, and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive en la misma ciudad junto con su pareja, él tiene 38 años y aun no tiene hijos. 

Victor es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues tiene tres actividades económicas que los distribuye  para estar en sus actividades durante el día por ejemplo: en las mañanas trabaja como empleado público en una entidad del estado y en sus horas libres se dedica a administrar su tienda de abarrotes y su negocio de venta de combustible. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Torrechayoc” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar combustible como gasolina,petróleo y asi aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro.  Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

(La ciudad de Paucartambo es la capital de la Provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Victor was born in the city of Paucartambo and lives in the same city with his wife. He is 38 years old and has no children as yet.

Victor is an enterprising and hard-working person who ventures out with much effort and dedication, since he has 3 separate economic activities distributed carefully during the day, so that he can be most active. For example, mornings he works as a public employee in a state entity, then in his free hours, Victor administers his grocery store and his fuel selling business. He has been pursuing these businesses for various years now and its going very well, thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

Victor belongs to the “Senor de Torrechayoc” communal bank and, on this occasion, he is requesting a loan to purchase fuels such as gasoline and fuel oil, to augment his working capital in this area. Victor values and is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with his monthly payment schedule very responsibly.

(The city of Paucartambo is the capital of the Province of Paucartambo, located within the Department of Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: buy fuels such as gasoline and fuel oil to sell.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn, age 29, raises hogs to earn an income. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has been engaged in her business for two years. She and her husband have three children, all of whom attend school. Jonalyn is pictured here with two of her children.

Jonalyn has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina, age 49, is a cassava farmer. She lives in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province with her husband and their three children. Two of the children are enrolled in school and the eldest is a paid worker. Sina and her husband are both engaged in cassava cropping, and the business generates about 28,400 KHR per day. In addition to working in the family agribusiness, her husband also works for others for a fee for extra income.

This will be Sina's third loan cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund, and she has successfully repaid both her previous loans. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR in order to plow her farmland and pay for labor costs. Additionally, she will use a portion of the funds to buy a plot of farmland to expand the scale of her crop farming. 

Sina hopes that she can increase her income so that she can build a house for her family.

loans.use: to plow her farmland and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia, de 51 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, es casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas. Zonia, se dedica a la venta de comida. Prepara a diario los más ricos platos característicos de la región, además de refrescos de frutas tropicales y otros. Trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijas quienes se encargan de la atención siempre de la mano con un trato agradable que es su mejor carta de presentación. Su puesto esta establecido en el frontis de su vivienda y atiende todos los días desde las 5 de la tarde. Su rutina se termina por la noche y toma este tiempo para descansar y renovar energía para que al día siguiente se levante muy temprano para irse al mercado en busca de los ingredientes que usa para preparar los potajes. Lleva en este rubro más de 10 años y lo complementa además con la venta de gaseosas y cervezas. Este trabajo le gusta mucho ya que le genera buenas ganancias económicas, pero también sabe que su clientela exige mucho más en cuanto a sabor y comodidad, es por eso que desea comprar los principales ingredientes que usa en su trabajo al por mayor para tenerlos siempre disponibles y una mesa amplia de buena calidad para brindar una mejor atención y continuar disfrutando de las satisfacciones que su trabajo le ofrece. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este crédito para continuar con el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará arroz, aceite, azúcar, carnes y otros abarrotes que usa continuamente en su trabajo, comprará también una mesa de mejor calidad para que sus clientes se sientan más cómodos.
texts.en:
Zonia is a 51 year old woman who is friendly and hard working. She is married and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. Zonia makes a living selling food. She prepares the most delicious dishes that are typical of the region everyday accompanied by tropical fruit drinks and other refreshments. She works with the help of her daughters who are in charge of attending to their customers with a friendly manner. 

Her stall is located in front of her home and she attends to customers everyday beginning at 5pm. Her work ends at night and she takes this time to rest and renew her energy to wake up early the next day to go to the market to buy the ingredients she needs for her dishes. She has been doing this work for over ten years and also sells soft drinks and beer. She likes her work a lot because she is able to generate good earnings and also because she knows that her customers have a high demand for the comfort and flavor at her restaurant. It is for this reason that she wishes to buy the main ingredients that she uses for work at wholesale prices in order to have them readily available. She will also buy a large, quality table to offer better service and continue enjoying the satisfaction of her job. 

She is now requesting 2000 nuevos soles. She is thankful to those who make her loan possible so that she can continue to achieve her objectives. She is also committed to fulfilling the punctual payment of her loan installments. With the amount requested she will buy rice, oil, meats and other groceries that she constantly uses at her business and will also buy a high quality table so that her customers can dine more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and other groceries, as well as a table for her customers.
